4:45.race_name: Sky Bet For The Fans Irish EBF Maiden

runners.name: Amadeus Mozart
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt out of a Galileo mare, Ryan Moore's choice from a Ballydoyle trio
runners.spotlight: Coolmore-bred Wootton Bassett colt; second foal; dam, by Galileo, failed to feature on only start, sister to winners Zagitova (Group-placed over 1m at two) and Frill (7f), half-sister to Group 1 winning-sprinter Garswood; Ryan Moore's choice from three-strong Ballydoyle challenge; stable 9-24 with juvenile runners this term.

runners.name: Dorset
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: E400,000 yearling, winning dam a sister to 1,000 Guineas/Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Winter
runners.spotlight: E400,000 yearling; by Wootton Bassett out of a Galileo mare; fourth foal, half-brother to winners Art Design and Neverstopdreaming, both successful at 6f; winning dam is a sister to 1,000 Guineas/Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Winter, out of Wokingham winner Laddies Poker Two.

runners.name: Flanker Jet
runners.comment: First foal out of 7f AW winner, half-sister to a useful 2yo winner, Colin Keane aboard
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns yearling; Oasis Dream colt; first foal; dam 7f AW winner, half-sister to useful 6f 2yo winner The Paddyman; family of Ribblesdale winner Gull Nook (dam of King George winner Pentire); Colin Keane aboard.

runners.name: Gold Youmzain
runners.comment: Half-brother to useful winners Maraseem (Group-placed) and Dream For Gold, solid pedigree
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother by Hello Youmzain to useful winners Maraseem (Group-placed) and Dream For Gold; dam unraced sister to Hong Kong 1m2f Group 1 winner Akeed Mofeed and UAE 6f Group 3 winner Jordan Sport.

runners.name: Green Soul
runners.comment: Non runner
runners.spotlight: Non runner

runners.name: Ipanema Beach
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: In the frame on both starts, already looks in need of further, cheekpieces fitted now
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to finish fourth behind the smart-looking Charles Darwin on debut in a 6f maiden at Navan in April; got a bit closer when third behind another Aidan O'Brien odds-on chance over 7f at Leopardstown; looks in need of further already; cheekpieces fitted now.

runners.name: Lake Como
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Half-brother by St Mark's Basilica to three winners including a Listed sprint scorer
runners.spotlight: 52,000gns foal, E130,000 yearling; eighth foal; half-brother by St Mark's Basilica to three winners, notably Lady Penelope, a Listed sprint winner for Joseph O'Brien; dam unraced half-sister to useful 5f-7f winner Enlace.

runners.name: Maximum Scepticism
runners.comment: Made a satisfactory debut when fourth in a 6f maiden here 11 days ago, 7f should suit
runners.spotlight: E225,000 yearling; made a satisfactory debut when fourth in a 6f maiden at this venue 11 days ago, faring a little better than a shorter-priced stablemate in a race in which Aidan O'Brien saddled winner and second; extra furlong should suit.

runners.name: Mr Kobe
runners.comment: Towards the back on debut over 5f at Cork, gelded since and hooded now, up against it
runners.spotlight: Towards the back on debut over 5f at Cork; gelded since and hooded now; up against it.

runners.name: Nod Of Approval
runners.comment: Half-brother by Ten Sovereigns to three winners, including Good Heavens, useful over 1m
runners.spotlight: McManus family homebred; seventh foal; half-brother by Ten Sovereigns to winners Good Heavens (two wins at 1m and second in Irish Cambridgeshire), Puturhandstogether (Flat/hurdle) and Showurappreciation (hurdle).

runners.name: The Holy Apostle
runners.comment: Half-brother to several winners, unraced dam out of a French Listed-placed juvenile winner
runners.spotlight: E4,000 yearling; ninth foal; half-brother to several winners; unraced dam out of a French Listed-placed juvenile winner.

runners.name: Beware Of The Bear
runners.comment: Seventh of 21 over C&D 12 days ago, less than one length behind fifth-placed Parkside Lad
runners.spotlight: Made a satisfactory debut when a staying-on seventh of 21 over C&D 12 days ago, less than one length behind fifth-placed Parkside Lad; trainer had a good winner in this age-group at Listowel on Sunday.

runners.name: Evening Blues
runners.comment: Decent effort behind the smart Albert Einstein last month, may make his experience count
runners.spotlight: Not given a hard race after meeting trouble in running on debut over 5f at this venue; ran as well as could have been expected when making the running before being mastered by Albert Einstein over this trip at Naas last month; winner has consolidated big reputation with a Group 3 win at this venue; may make his experience count now.

runners.name: Flushing Meadows
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett half-brother to winners, out of winning sister to top-class Alice Springs
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother by Wootton Bassett to winners Gasper De Lemos (Group-placed over 1m2f at two in Zetland Stakes, later raced as Mega Force in Hong Kong) and Dame Kiri (6f 2yo); dam Group-placed 1m winner by Galileo, sister to three-time Group 1 winner Alice Springs.

runners.name: Glowgetter
runners.comment: Dam by Epaulette failed to win, runner-up 11 times, plenty of speed in the pedigree
runners.spotlight: Homebred; first foal; dam, by Epaulette, failed to win, runner-up 11 times; plenty of speed in the pedigree.

runners.name: Killourney Reigns
runners.comment: Hads no luck in running when seventh of nine in a strong maiden over 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Respectable sixth over C&D early last month, having been slowly away; no luck in running when seventh of nine in a strong maiden over 11 days ago; needs to break quicker.

runners.name: Lewis Carroll
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: By Siyouni, dam Listed-placed 5f winner, half-sister to 2,000 Guineas winner Saxon Warrior
runners.spotlight: Coolmore homebred by Siyouni; first foal; dam Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner, half-sister to Racing Post Trophy and 2,000 Guineas winner Saxon Warrior and Drumroll (1m2f Group 3), out of Moyglare Stud Stakes winner Maybe, family of Derby winner Dr Devious.

runners.name: North Coast
runners.comment: 180,000gns yearling, Starman colt, second foal, dam a US turf winner including stakes
runners.spotlight: 42,000gns foal, 180,000gns yearling; Starman colt, second foal; dam a US turf winner (including stakes), half-sister to useful winners Cook Islands (1m 2yo) and Silky (1m2f), out of 1m 2yo winning half-sister to Arc runner-up Mubtaker.

runners.name: Parkside Lad
runners.comment: Fifth in a 21-runner C&D maiden 12 days ago, closely matched with Beware Of The Bear
runners.spotlight: Raced prominently for a long way before fading into fifth in a 21-runner C&D maiden 12 days ago; closely matched with Beware Of The Bear, both colts open to improvement.

runners.name: Puerto Rico
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt out of a sister to top-class winners Misty For Me and Ballydoyle
runners.spotlight: First foal; by Wootton Bassett out of a Group-placed juvenile winner by Galileo; dam is a sister to too-class winners Misty For Me (Irish 1,000 Guineas) and Ballydoyle (Prix Marcel Boussac), out of unraced half-sister to top-class sprinting 2yo Fasliyev.

runners.name: Sand Art
runners.comment: 100-1, finished last of nine in a strong C&D maiden on debut, unlikely to feature.
runners.spotlight: 100-1, finished last of nine in a strong C&D maiden on debut; unlikely to feature.

runners.name: Suspicious Mindz
runners.comment: Half-brother by Bated Breath to four winners, notably Norfolk Stakes winner The Ridler
runners.spotlight: 170,000gns yearling; sixth foal; half-brother by Bated Breath to four winners, notably The Ridler, long-priced Norfolk Stakes winner for Richard Fahey in 2022; dam, by Lope De Vega, placed over 7f as a juvenile.

runners.name: The Pipers Call
runners.comment: E55,000 yearling, second foal, dam unplaced on only start, but has a decent pedigree
runners.spotlight: E55,000 yearling; second foal; dam unplaced on only start, sister to winners Fleet Review (6f Listed) and Dual Career (Japanese 6f), out of winning sister to Group 1 winner Rip Van Winkle; solid pedigree; from a small County Kildare yard.

runners.name: Sky Watch
runners.comment: £80,000 Goffs UK Breeze-Up purchase, half-sister by Starman to 7f winner Jenni
runners.spotlight: £80,000 Goffs UK Breeze-up purchase; fourth foal; half-sister by Starman to 7f winner Jenni (RPR 78); dam 6f AW 2yo winner (63), half-sister to US 1m Grade 2 winner The Mackem Bullet.

runners.name: Worldly
runners.comment: Half-sister to four winners, dam 7f winner out of Fillies' Mile winner White Moonstone
runners.spotlight: E3,000 yearling; fifth foal; half-sister to four winners; dam 7f winner in France, by Dubawi out of the 2010 Fillies' Mile winner White Moonstone.

5:50.race_name: Spar Shop At The Curragh Maiden

runners.name: On The Way
runners.comment: Down the field in two Dundalk runs, no apparent chance on his belated turf debut.
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two Dundalk runs; no apparent chance on his belated turf debut.

runners.name: Sosperi
runners.comment: First foal out of a 1m winner, makes belated debut at four for a locally-based trainer.
runners.spotlight: First foal; Le Havre filly; dam 1m winner, half-sister to winners Thrill Seeker and Sherkin Island; makes belated debut at four for a locally-based trainer.

runners.name: Colter Bay
runners.breeder: S A R L Mariol Racing
runners.comment: Half-brother to French winners including the Group-placed Kilfrush Memories, 10lb claimer
runners.spotlight: E57,000 yearling; fifth foal; half-brother to French winners including the Group-placed Kilfrush Memories; dam maiden half-sister to 1m Listed winner Pisanello; 10lb claimer rides.

runners.name: Fedal
runners.comment: In good hands but no sign of winning potential in two sprint maidens, tongue-tie fitted
runners.spotlight: In good hands but no sign of winning potential in two sprint maidens; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Green Kite
runners.comment: Tenth foal, half-brother to three winners winner dam effective around 1m
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-brother to three winners; winner dam effective around 1m, sister to 5f-1m winner My Lucky Locket.

runners.name: Jordan Breeze
runners.comment: Brother to a winning juvenile for this yard who went on to prosper in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; brother to winners, notably Starspangledwaves, winner of a 5f Dundalk maiden for this stable in 2022 and later a high-class sprinter in Hong Kong as Beauty Waves (5f Group 3) dam 5f winner, half-sister to US 5f stakes winner Queen Amira, out of US 5f-7f stakes winner.

runners.name: Marlborough Place
runners.comment: E160,000 Breeeze Up buy, sure to know his job, Colin Keane takes the ride for Amo Racing
runners.spotlight: E160,000 Arqana Breeze Up purchase last year; third foal; by Showcasing, out of an unraced half-sister to Listed-placed 7f winner Iptisam;  sure to know his job; Colin Keane takes the ride in the Amo colours.

runners.name: Melvin Udall
runners.comment: Half-brother to 6f winner Lord Abama, dam 5f/6f winner, makes debut with cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to 6f winner Lord Abama; dam 5f/6f winner; makes debut with cheekpieces on.

runners.name: Ribble Emperor
runners.comment: Brother to a nursery winner, dam closely related to useful Group 3 winner Jack Naylor
runners.spotlight: Third foal; brother to AW nursery winner Irrelevant; dam ran four times, closely related to useful Group 3 winner Jack Naylor.

runners.name: Titan Sun
runners.comment: Backed at big prices when creditable fifth of 21 here at two, poor run on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Backed into 15-2 from big prices on debut over 6f here last October, showed speed before weakening into fifth in a 21-runner contest; failed to show similar form on reappearance at Sligo; hood and tongue-tie on now.

runners.name: Zammawar
runners.comment: Second foal, dam unraced half-sister to French Listed-placed 1m winner Gaazaal, hooded
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unraced half-sister to French Listed-placed 1m winner Gaazaal, out of 1m winning half-sister to 1m Group 2 winner Pollyanna; hooded.

runners.name: Angel Of Promise
runners.comment: Inexperienced at Navan on only start at two, big price then, best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Inexperienced at Navan on only start at two; big price then; best watched for now.

runners.name: Cold Hearted
runners.comment: Useful form at two, has confirmed a fair standard in two 6f outings here this season
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in maidens last season before an ambitious bid in a Listed race at Newmarket; has confirmed a fair standard of form in two 6f outings at this venue this season; third behind No Return (handicap winner since) and second to the well-fancied Bonus Time 12 days ago; should go close.

runners.name: Lady Mary Heath
runners.comment: Unseated her rider early on debut, in rear on second attempt, can be safely ruled out
runners.spotlight: Unseated her rider early on debut; in rear on second attempt; can be safely ruled out.

runners.name: Naval Ensign
runners.comment: Promise on only start at two, needs to step up on the form of Gowran reappearance
runners.spotlight: Promising debut when sixth of 21 here last October, only a neck behind today's rival Titan Sun; failed to make an impact over 7f on a heavy ground at Gowran six weeks ago.

runners.name: Phoenix Pairc
runners.comment: Made late headway over 1m at Gowran, shorter trip might not be ideal on that evidence
runners.spotlight: Slowly away before making some late headway over 1m at Gowran; shorter trip might not be ideal on that evidence.

runners.name: Regenerate
runners.comment: Closely related to Listed-placed 5f winner Rayong, dam 5f AW 2yo winner, could go well
runners.spotlight: £50,000 yearling; fourth foal; closely related to Listed-placed 5f winner Rayong; dam 5f AW 2yo winner, sister to three winners; potentially interesting newcomer from respected source.

runners.name: Stella Alpina
runners.comment: Improved effort at Cork making a race of it with the short-priced favourite, good chance
runners.spotlight: Promise on debut last season at Naas (6f, yielding) for Sheila Lavery and again on first start for this stable at Gowran (7f, heavy) after almost a year off; improved on good ground at Cork, making a race of it with the short-priced favourite who bumped her late when hanging left under pressure; strong contender.

runners.name: Yquem
runners.comment: No impact on debut at Cork, well held by Cold Hearted on running here 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: 33-1 when slowly away and well-beaten on debut at Cork (6f, good); well held by Cold Hearted on running here 12 days ago.

runners.name: Unexpected Issues
runners.comment: 5f maiden winner, good effort in Listed latest, may be well treated, fast ground a query
runners.spotlight: Highly tried since 5f Navan (yielding) debut win last May; mark rose from 84 to 91 after a 4.5l third of 7 in the Listed Woodlands Stakes at Naas (5f, gd-yld) on seasonal return (split older rivals rated 112 and 106); could go well off 91 on handicap debut but very quick ground a query.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Unexpected Issues is going to be an early two-year-old. I suppose we'll run maybe once more and think about something in Ascot for her. She was a little bit green, a little bit slow away and then ran around a bit. She should come forward for that. She's only worked once on grass so she should improve - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

runners.name: Jorge Alvares
runners.comment: AW maiden winner, touched off by Red Evolution latest, obvious chance from high draw
runners.spotlight: AW maiden winner (6f); in fine form since joining this yard; denied by a short head by Red Evolution on first try at 5f at Cork latest; obvious chance from good draw off the same mark.

runners.name: Saratoga Special
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, solid form at two, won Cork maiden on return, good listed fourth latest
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; solid form at two (including over C&D) without winning; off the mark in a 5f Cork maiden (good) on seasonal return in April; not a bad effort in first-time tongue tie in Listed race latest; preferred by Foley; not discounted on handicap debut.

runners.name: Red Evolution
runners.comment: Won two of last three, beat Jorge Alvares by a head off 2lb lower latest, draw not ideal
runners.spotlight: Has won two of last three starts, a 5f maiden at Dundalk in January and beat Jorge Alvares by a short head at Cork (5f, good) two weeks ago; just 2lb higher now but draw could have been kinder.

runners.name: Dark Ace
runners.comment: Two 6f wins on AW last year, not as good last twice, 5lb lower on turf, watch back at 5f
runners.spotlight: Looked a smart prospect when winning back to back 6f races at Dundalk last year; not as good in two starts this season, including when beaten off 89 on handicap debut at Newcastle latest; rated 5lb lower on turf but probably best watched dropped back to 5f.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: We probably actually expected that two runs ago on his first start as Dark Ace showed us plenty at home, but the first day he ran a bit free and things didn't go to plan. We worked him up here last week on the surface and he worked well - Adam Caffrey, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Brigids Cloak
runners.comment: Progressive, won easily off 12lb lower here latest (6f, good), nicely drawn, this tougher
runners.spotlight: Progressive sort won a fillies' handicap in dominant fashion here last month (6f, good), ridden positively; hiked up 12lb and drops back to 5f for the first time; nicely drawn and could be more to come from her but this is tougher.

runners.name: Bobbi Rosa
runners.comment: Won Tipperary maiden on penultimate, clipped heels latest, dropped 5lb, not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Shed maiden tag on penultimate start in a 5f Tipperary maiden (yielding); finished last of 8 when behind a couple of these rivals at Cork latest (clipped heels and stumbled); 5lb lower now and not dismissed.

runners.name: Lethimfly
runners.comment: 5f maiden winner, fine effort behind two of these at Cork on return, 3lb lower; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Won a Bellewstown maiden last July (5f, good); pleasing return when a 2.5l third behind Red Evolution and Jorge Alvares at Cork (5f, good); 3lb lower and should improve for that run; top rider booked and blinkers go on; place chance.

runners.name: Agouti Bear
runners.comment: Made all at Sligo (Shoney behind), blinkers back on, drops to 5f, should make bold bid
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in two of four starts at two, including in a 6f maiden here on debut; beat Shoney by 2.5l on seasonal return at Sligo (6f, good), making all; blinkers return; should make a bold bid.

runners.name: Sarahmae
runners.owner: Mary B Hogan & Michael M Obrien
runners.comment: Won at Tipperary latest, 7lb higher now, should be suited by strongly run race, considered
runners.spotlight: Gained second career win at Tipperary (5f, yld-sft) latest off 71; 7lb higher now; badly missed the break on penultimate when a 3.25l fourth behind Red Evolution and Jorge Alvares at Cork; seems to go on any ground and will be suited by a strongly run race; considered.

quotes.race: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: I kept it straightforward today, back with an ease in the ground and she looks this quick 5f. She's improving away - Joey Sheridan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Shoney
runners.comment: Made all at Tipperary latest, makes handicap debut, draw not ideal but not discounted
runners.spotlight: Unexposed handicap debutante ran out an emphatic winner of a 5f maiden at Tipperary (yld-sft) latest, making all; beaten 2.5l by Agouti Bear on penultimate at Sligo (6f, good); weighted to get closer to that rival; draw not ideal but she can't be fully discounted.

quotes.race: It's A Long Way To Being 50 Shane Anderson Maiden
quotes.quote: She ran well at Sligo and thought Shoney come on for it and she did, she was good. She jumped well from the gates and travelled and I was able to tack across to the middle of the track. When I gave her a squeeze, everything behind me when silent and I had gone clear. She's not big but she's hardy. She's a good mover, I think she'll go on any ground - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Smoke Them Out
runners.comment: Won nice pot at Cork last year off 6lb lower, gelded after fifth latest, visor, needs more
runners.spotlight: Won a nice pot at Cork (6f, gd-yld) last October off 72; went close off revised mark of 82 eleven days later; not in same form this year and gelded after 4.75l fifth at Naas early last month; handicapper relenting but needs more in first-time visor.

runners.name: Turners Cross
runners.owner: Dan Kiely & P V Breen & Chris Dineen & M Stafford
runners.comment: 0-7, disappointing this season, blinkers on for h'cap bow, looks stable second string
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 0-7 but did run well in defeat on final two starts of last season; struggled both starts this term at Cork, beaten 11l in a 6f maiden there latest; blinkers go on for handicap debut; Foley prefers stablemate.

runners.name: Gazelle Dor

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Renata Coleman & Aidan Gleeson & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Scored off 75 here on in April (6f), strongly run race will suit, cheekpieces on, go well
runners.spotlight: Won twice at two; in fine form this season, winning on return here over 6f (good) off 75 and just 2lb higher now; good efforts in defeat since at Naas and Fairyhouse, both at 6f; will be suited by a strongly run race at this trip; could go well in first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Slane Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Gazelle D'or has done very well to win that. The whole thing today was about just switching her off and getting her to come home good. She travelled lovely the whole way and, just when she got there, she just idled a small bit underneath me - Jack Cleary, rider.

runners.name: Tropical Retreat
runners.comment: Dundalk maiden winner, a lot went wrong latest, hood on, 3lb wrong, may outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Dundalk maiden winner in February (5f); excuses when 4l behind Red Evolution and a couple more of these on turf and handicap debut at Cork (slow away, saddle slipped) so did well in the circumstances; 3lb wrong here, drawn low and wears first-time hood but could outrun odds.

runners.name: Miss Australie
runners.comment: Better effort in Roscommon h'cap latest, rated just 52, more needed back in a maiden
runners.spotlight: Poor in first two starts this season but improved effort latest, albeit in a handicap off 53; lots more needed back in maiden company.

runners.name: Royal Hollow
runners.comment: Winning hurdler, ran well in Flat maidens at 9.5f and 1m4f a year apart, obvious chance
runners.spotlight: 7yo; progressive over hurdles and went close in Listed mares' race in that sphere on latest; ran well in Flat maidens at Roscommon (1m4f, soft) and Gowran (9.5f, yielding) a year apart; beaten just 0.5l in the latter race; has to give weight to younger rivals but has obvious chance.

runners.name: Shades Of Gray
runners.comment: 100-1 and never figured on belated debut at Naas last month, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 100-1 and never figured on belated debut at Naas (1m, good) last month; steps up in trip; may need more time

runners.name: Camevere
runners.comment: Promise in maidens at Dundalk at 1m-10.5f, cheekpieces go on, should stay, chance
runners.spotlight: Has shown promise in two maidens at Dundalk over 1m and 10.5f; cheekpieces go on and pedigree suggests she should stay this longer trip; not without a chance if ready to go after a two month break.

runners.name: Diamond Exchange
runners.owner: Bronsan Racing & H Redknapp & John Breslin
runners.comment: Promise on debut here (7f) and again on latest at Leopardstown (1m2f), should go well
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett filly has run well in two of her three maiden starts; best effort a 4l second of 6 at Leopardstown latest at 1m2f; dam won at this trip so she should stay; holds Group entries and should go well.

runners.name: Earthsong
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: 22-1, slowly away and finished last of 6 on debut at Cork (1m4f), hard to fancy after that
runners.spotlight: Camelot filly was sent off at 22-1 on debut at Cork (1m4f, good) and finished last of 6 after starting slowly; held by Tenoya on that form and Irish Oaks entry looks fanciful on that evidence; others preferred.

runners.name: Grace My Love
runners.owner: Eleanora Kennedy & Mrs J S Bolger
runners.comment: Last of 9 on debut last October when 40-1, trip a query on breeding, needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Parish Hall filly was 40-1 on debut at Leopardstown (1m, soft) and failed to beat a rival home; breeding suggests this trip may stetch her; needs to improve plenty to feature.

runners.name: Its A Heartbeat
runners.comment: Outran 50-1 odds on debut at Naas (10.5f), bred for this trip, leading form claims
runners.spotlight: Too Darn Hot filly was a big price for her debut at Naas (10.5f, yielding) but she ran a fine race to finish a 2.75l fourth; should improve plenty for that experience and is bred to appreciate this longer trip; leading claims.

runners.name: Jannah Star
runners.comment: Well-backed on debut and not beaten far on heavy, claims if handling quicker conditions
runners.spotlight: Expensive Sea The Stars filly one of three for yard; sent off favourite for debut at Limerick (1m4f, sft-hvy) and ran a pleasing race to finish a 2l third of 7; different ground to contend with here, chance if handles it; preferred by McMonagle.

runners.name: Mveve
runners.comment: Best form has come on AW (rated 80), turf form not as good, stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; has shown ability in three starts on the AW and rated 80 in that sphere; 50-1 and well beaten in 3yo fillies' race at Killarney last month; stamina to prove and McMonagle prefers Jannah Star.

runners.name: Nancee Spain
runners.comment: 100-1 and tailed off on debut here over 1m2f, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Calyx filly was sent off at 100-1 and tailed off on debut here over 1m2f; hard to fancy on that evidence.

runners.name: Onaqui
runners.comment: Non Runner
runners.spotlight: Non runner

runners.name: Tenoya
runners.comment: Faded late when third on debut at Cork over this trip, improve for that, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Persian King filly showed up well for a long way on debut in 1m4f Cork maiden won by stablemate Royal Entry, eventually fading into third (Earthsong behind); should improve plenty for that and Billy Lee now takes over; can't be discounted.

runners.name: Vegas Whipper
runners.comment: 125-1, missed the break and never involved on debut at Gowran, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Daughter of Belardo was 125-1 when missing the break and never involved on debut at Gowran; may need more time

7:30.race_name: Sky Bet Race To The Ebor Handicap (Premier Handicap)

runners.name: Harbour Wind
runners.comment: Talented and consistent, three-time Listed winner, goes well fresh, respected on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; talented and consistent stayer is 5-9 including three Listed wins at 12.5f-2m on good and soft ground; lacks a run but won first time up last season; top-weight is respected on handicap debut (holds Irish St Leger entry).

quotes.race: Prix Gladiateur (Group 3) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Harbour Wind has run a very good race. In that ground, it's probably as far as he wants to go. He's tried hard, he's run well and he looked like he was going to win a furlong down. The ground is probably a little bit slower than we'd like, because he's won on firm ground. He's been a long time between races and I think he'll come on for it. We'll think about it [the Melbourne Cup]. I'll have a chat with his owner, Eva-Maria Bucher-Haefner, and we'll go from there - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Martin Molony Stakes (Listed)
quotes.quote: It was a workmanlike, battling performance from Harbour Wind under a very good ride from Chris Hayes. We'll see how he comes out of the race and discuss future plans with the owner as to where we go next. He'll be sharper for that. The Melbourne Cup is in my thoughts, but it is early days and we will see how the year progresses. He has to step up considerably - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Chaudenay (Group 2) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Harbour Wind has run a big race and we're very pleased. He'll make into a lovely horse next year and that's it for this year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Aer Lingus College Football Classic Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Harbour Wind is still a big, immature horse. He's a next-year horse and will be trained accordingly. We'll talk about whether to run him again this year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race
quotes.quote: Harbour Wind did it well. It was a funny sort of race as I think something happened to Colin Keane's reins and you can't read too much into the distances on testing ground. The one thing we didn't know was would he handle the ground and he handled it well. He came up the hill well. We'll take it from there and see how he progresses - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Star Harbour
runners.comment: Seven time winner, never won over this far, in form but others appeal more at this trip
runners.spotlight: Heavily raced sort has won seven times on turf at 1m-1m4f; beaten 0.5l on last two starts, over 1m4f at Cork off 98 and 1m2f off 97 here on latest; never won over this far; others make more appeal at this trip.

quotes.race: Happy 60th Birthday To Ger Dunne Of Punchestown Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour was running over a trip well short of his best. We had him entered at Chester last weekend but we took him out because of the ground and because this race was there for him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish EBF Ragusa Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Star Harbour has been very consistent, he won a good one last year in the Racing League as well. He's a great horse. We were to go to Yarmouth for the Racing League but that could put him out of the ratings. if it does he could go to Galway - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Castleisland Rated Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour got a top class ride. He is entered in the Galway Mile and if the handicapper isn't too hard on him he will go there instead of the Curragh on Sunday. He probably didn't quite stay at Down Royal but in time I think he will - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal County Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We put blinkers on Star Harbour last time but he missed the break and got caught in behind. He has a lot of ability and he wasn't a cheap colt. We have castrated him as he was a bit of a boyo and wasn't giving us everything. We did feel he had a lot of ability and I said I'd run him in this even though we were a couple of pounds out of the handicap as he'd have a light weight on his back. He put it to bed fairly quickly. He'll be nice for a mile-and-a-half handicap at Galway or as regards closer plans I was talking about the Ulster Derby - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Chally Chute
runners.comment: Three time winner on easy ground, 8lb above last win, ground a worry, new yard, watch
runners.spotlight: Won three for Mick Halford and Tracy Collins at 1m4f-2m1f on easy ground; remains 8lb above last win and this ground may be on the quick side; best watched on debut for new yard.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Handicap
quotes.quote: He's a pleasure to train, Chally Chute is improving steadily and we are having great fun with him. A couple of opportunities we had to pass because we felt the ground was too quick for him so I was keen to run him this week. The whole idea was to see how he stays and plan the rest of the season for him, the Irish Cesarewitch was in the back of my head for a long time. He won at Galway last autumn so the plan will be to go back, we might give him an entry in the 2m early in the week and then the 1m4f on the Friday - Michael Halford, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Chally Chute is getting better with racing. He had a setback as a three-year-old and we just had to wait for him - he's improving all the time. He handled Dundalk well when he won up there, but I wasn't too worried about this ground with him being by Fast Company. It was a nice race and a nice track for him. Jamie was very cool on him. The plan wasn't to be that far back on him but he rode him for luck and it happened for them - Mick Halford, trainer.

runners.name: Falcon Eight
runners.owner: Dr R Lambe & Dr J Climax

prev_owners.owner: Dr R Lambe & Dr J Climax
Dr R Lambe & Dr J Climax

runners.comment: Dual-purpose veteran, first win since 2023 on latest, would prefer softer ground
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; likeable dual-purpose veteran is 7-29 on turf on the Flat; had a few of these behind when gaining first win since 2023 on seasonal return at Gowran (1m6f, yielding) in April; on competitive mark but best form is on easy ground; needs rain.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Loughbrown Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight is as tough as teak and was unlucky not to win the last two runnings of the Irish Cesarewitch. He deserved to win a race like this. He's been a cracking horse to train - Dermot Weld, trainer

quotes.race: Friends Of The Curragh Irish Cesarewitch (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight loves to come from off the pace and got a very good ride. He doesn't do things quickly and likes to warm his way into it. He's a grand stayer, a Chester Cup winner, but he just didn't get the run of the race for the second year running. Maybe he'll come back for a third time next year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: tote Always SP Or Better At The Curragh Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight was always going to get there from a furlong out and he won easily at the line. He'll probably go back over hurdles now after a break - Kris Weld, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight did it well. The ground was probably slower than ideal but he jumped well. We need to get more experience under his belt - Kris Weld, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: tote+ Chester Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: The plan was for Frankie to take his time. Falcon Eight had top weight and the ground wasn't ideal so patience was key. The reason Frankie likes riding my horses is because I love them to get into a rhythm and that suits Frankie. He waited until the horse handled the track and the ground and then said 'right, let's go.' The rest is history. The Ascot Stakes or the Queen Alexandra will be his next port of call now. We'll aim him at Royal Ascot. I have an eye on the Melbourne Cup for him later in the year too - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: JOC Metal Fabrication Limited Race
quotes.quote: He is learning how to be a racehorse and is still very immature and is far from the finished article. We hope he will make into a very nice four-year-old next year and we've had to be patient with him and it's paying off. He'll have one more run this year in six weeks' time. He won't be a St Leger horse this year but it would be lovely if he made into an Irish St Leger horse next year; it's a race dad has a good record in so it would be nice to add to it. We'll take baby steps for now and see where we end up - Kris Weld, assistant to Dermot Weld, trainer

quotes.race: Hanlon Concrete Maiden
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight has been a very late-maturing horse but I was certain he would run a nice race today. He is a colt with a lot of long term potential and today is only the start. He should be a very nice staying horse next year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The ground went against him in the race last year so that wasn't his true running. I thought he ran well in the Chester Cup last time given he had to carry 9st 12lb and Frankie thought he ran a very good race. 09-06-22

runners.name: Helvic Dream
runners.owner: Mrs Caroline Hendron & Mrs M Cahill
runners.comment: Five-time Flat winner, Gr 1 winner in pomp, in form over hurdles but needs testing ground
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner has been in good form over timber; was a Group 1 winner here in his pomp in 2021; still capable of smart form on the level but is most effective on testing ground.

quotes.race: Navan Ford & Opel Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I said the other day that if Helvic Dream was in a Group race on the Flat, I'd fancy him, because he was that well in himself. He's still novicey for anything big, so I would have thought we'll try and get another run into him somewhere and then tip along. He will go back on the Flat again this year - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote, Never Beaten by SP Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Helvic Dream enjoyed himself and did not do a lot in front but he won comfortably. He used to be very keen but he was very settled there in a messy race. He could be a Supreme Novice horse - Patrick Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Gold Cup (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Colin (Keane) said he was going to sit a bit closer and have one go at Broome. He felt he went too soon for Helvic Dream the last day and he felt he did again today. He has an electrifying turn of speed but lasted it out. It was a brilliant ride. He's been a pleasure to train and doesn't take a lot of work. There have been plenty of people interesting in buying him but thankfully the owners have kept faith in me as I felt he could win a Group 1 - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Novi IT Services International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I thought he was good all year but things just haven't gone right for him with one thing and another. I don't know where he will go next but there is the possibility we could travel with him. He'll stick to Stakes races now. He loves soft ground. He wouldn't want fast ground but I think he'll go on good ground - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Gavin [Ryan] gave him a lovely ride but he said it was very easy. They went a good gallop and he did exactly what he said he would. When he pulled him out he said he just had to change his hands and away he went. He loved the ground and quickened up well on it. Colin [Keane] loved this fella from the twice he rode him and Chris [Hayes] said last time he'd improve a lot because he was still green. The reason I claimed off him was because Dermot Weld was claiming 5lb off his runner and we would have been giving his filly 9lb as it was. I'd imagine we'll head to the final of the Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Series - Noel Meade, trainer of Helvic Dream

quotes.race: Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He hadn't been showing us much at all at home before he ran well on his first start and he got into a little bit of trouble at Galway. Colin [Keane] has loved him all the time - he was pretty confident that he was a pretty decent horse. I'd imagine he'll go for the final of this series and we'll probably give him another run before that. He's thriving all the time. I'd say the ground was an advantage to him. I felt that he mightn't be a real fast ground horse. I bought him off Joanna Morgan and she told me 'you have to buy him' - she was right. He hasn't got a great pedigree but he's a very good looking horse, big and strong - Noel Meade, trainer of Helvic Dream

runners.name: Taipan
runners.comment: Four-time winner, weighted to turn Gowran form with Falcon Eight around, chance if rains
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner including two at this trip; beaten 1.25l by Falcon Eight on seasonal return at Gowran (1m6f, yielding); is 4lb better off now so could reverse that but fast ground may not be ideal; not discounted if it rains.

quotes.race: Rockshore Refreshingly Irish Race
quotes.quote: Taipan has been ready to run for about six weeks but the ground has come up quick, he just needs a little ease. He might have another go at the Cesarewitch and maybe the English one too - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Taipan is a gorgeous laid back horse and we gave him all the time in the world. I wasn't sure if today was his day, he never travelled at any stage but that's the way he is at home. He'll be a lovely staying horse for next year - Shane Foley, rider

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for a winners' of one race at Killarney next and we'll aim him at a premier handicap on Guineas weekend at the Curragh. The key to him is a little bit of ease in the ground, he doesn't need it quite as soft as he used to. 21-04-23

This beautiful son of Frankel was one we gave plenty of time to last season. He finally made his debut on November 1 at Naas, where he was drawn on the outside in stall 17 of 18. I told Shane [Foley] to let the race unfold and see what happened. He wasn't very quickly away and was mid-division but easily made his way through the field and went fourth with a furlong left to run, then once Shane asked him he ran on strongly to take the race. I was delighted with that effort as he justified the faith I've always had in him. This big, raw horse has really thrived physically since then. If all goes well the plan is to start him off in the Ballysax Stakes at Leopardstown over 1m2f next month and I'd say he'll get 1m4f in time. He's an exciting prospect. 17-03-21

runners.name: Sixandahalf
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, fine effort in Irish Cesarewitch last year, fit from jumps, leading chance
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose hurdles winner is 2-6 on the Flat; went close in the Mares' Novice at Cheltenham in March; fine third in the Irish Cesarewitch here (2m1f, good) last September off 88; won over this trip at Newmarket in August; fit from hurdles and leading claims back in this sphere.

quotes.race: Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Dawn Run Mares' Novices' Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Sixandahalf ran really well - jumped and travelled really well everywhere, and probably just could have done with something to lead her a bit further. I did think after jumping the last that she was going to go away and win. I suppose there was a target on my back then. She jumped brilliantly and didn't do anything wrong - she just got beat - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sixandahalf jumps really well and we couldn't have asked for better. She has an engine and a good attitude. Hopefully she will end up in the mares' novice hurdle at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Mallow Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: She didn't feel like a bumper horse. Sixandahalf relaxed lovely and went to sleep, I left her there and had a bit of ground to make up in the straight but she came alive very quick and hit the line strong. She's plenty of gears - Gary Carroll, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Haier INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Sixandahalf has obviously improved from the first day when she was very green and I'm delighted with the way she picked up and quickened away. I thought if she ran well here that she might win a summer bumper, so I'm delighted - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She was only a breaker this time last year, so she's achieved an awful lot in a short space of time. You wouldn't believe she had her first career start in March but she's since been very good in her bumper win at Punchestown and also on the Flat. She was third in the Irish Cesarewitch and then went over to Newmarket but had a stone bruise. She had a break for three weeks and is just back in. I'm not sure where she'll start off yet but it'll be in a maiden hurdle and you'd be dreaming of the mares' novice hurdle at the Cheltenham Festival for her. She's not a big mare but is very gutsy. 12-11-24

She had a break for three weeks and is just back in. You'd be dreaming of the Mares' Novices' Hurdle. Her bumper win at Punchestown was very good and her runs on the Flat have been too. She was a very good third in the Irish Cesarewitch. She isn't a big mare but is gutsy and you wouldn't believe she had her first start in March. She's achieved an awful lot in a short space of time. 13-11-24

runners.name: Riviera Queen
runners.comment: Handicap debutante, won Tramore maiden last August, tailed off latest, Foley deserts
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; handicap debutante; Tramore maiden winner over 1m4f last August; best effort since a 4.75l fourth of 16 in a Listed race at Naas (1m4f, yielding); tailed off in Listed race here latest; Foley prefers stablemate.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly. She ran very well when third at Leopardstown earlier this month and has really strengthened up over the winter. She should be a nice staying filly as she's bred to get a mile and a half, maybe a mile and six furlongs. 24-04-24

runners.name: Zanndabad
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Without a win since 2022, good efforts in defeat in hot h'caps last year, chance
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 4-16 on the Flat but winless since October 2022; sound effort when sixth in the Irish Cesarewitch off this mark (didn't get clear run); also ran well in the Chester Cup last May (18.5f, gd-fm); this trip probably a minimum but will be doing his best work at the finish; has gone well fresh and Keane booked; chance.

quotes.race: Duke Of Westminster Supporting The Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It was just bad luck. Zanndabad missed the break and we were always on the back foot. But we're all still here and we live to fight another day - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.name: Smooth Tom
runners.comment: Easy hurdles win latest, good third in 1m handicap here in March, this trip a worry
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; fine effort last start on the Flat here in March when third in the Irish Lincolnshire (1m, soft); won Cork rated hurdle easily on latest in April (2m, soft); acts on quick ground but this trip might just stretch him.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hurdle
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom is a grand horse. I had a mad idea, I am thinking of entering him in the Chester Cup and go 2m2f on the Flat. He's that type of horse. It's only an idea at the moment. Also, we were having a chat, we might supplement him for the Champion Hurdle at Punchestown. We'll see what happens. If there's only five runners in it why not have a go.  We fancied him going to Down Royal and he unseated and he galloped for a mile and a half on the ambulance road. I don't know what happened in Punchestown. He was beaten after two hurdles. Obviously that had an effect that day so we left him off and we never looked back. Last year I was thinking of the Galway Hurdle but I might have his sister for that, Royal Hollow, that's her aim. We could run two of them, you never know. We have a couple of options, back here for the Cork Derby maybe as well. We won't make up our minds yet, there's plenty of options - Andrew Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom is a very versatile horse and I would say he'll stay further. I forgot to enter him in the Irish Cesarewitch and I think it would have suited him. We'll probably go for the Grade 3 hurdle at Down Royal a week on Friday. He likes small fields and he can pick up some more prize-money - Andy Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: Nua Healthcare Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom's main aim is the Galway Hurdle and we might go to Punchestown before then, probably for one of the handicap hurdles - Andrew Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Fishery Lane Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom is a nice horse. We were a bit worried about the ground. Andy was talking about giving him a rest, but we might take a look at Leopardstown over Christmas. He's going to have to step up now - Willie Slattery, assistant trainer.

runners.name: En Or
runners.breeder: E U R L Freddy Head
runners.comment: 5-24 on turf, 15lb above last win in this sphere, course form poor, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 5-24 on turf on the Flat including at this trip; is 15lb above last turf win which came at Clonmel last September (16.5f, good); hasn't shone in two previous runs at this venue; others make more appeal.

runners.name: Its Tim
runners.comment: 2-3 on turf, beaten off 12lb lower in class 5 at Nottingham latest, needs career best
runners.spotlight: British raider; AW winner is 2-3 on turf; beaten 3.25l when third of 6 on latest in class 5 handicap at Nottingham (1m6f, gd-fm) and 12lb higher here; previously won back to back 1m6f races on the AW at Chelmsford and Wolves by combined distance of 20l; career best needed.

runners.name: Jabbar
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, 4-14 on turf, fine run in 2m Premier last year, not discounted; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 4-14 on turf on the Flat; went close in 2m Premier Handicap at Naas off 9lb lower last October (soft); promising effort at Killarney latest (2m1f, good); has won at this trip and he's not discounted in first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Rated Race
quotes.quote: Jabbar won well. I wondered with the weather would he be fit enough but he clearly was. We won't go back over hurdles until April maybe but we'll stay on the AW until then - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Vischio

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the late John Kennedy / Mrs Alison Kennedy

runners.comment: Won nice pot over hurdles in February, Listed course winner at 1m4f, big ask back on Flat
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; five-time winner on the Flat; won big pot over hurdles at Leopardstown in February; last win in this sphere a 1m4f Listed race here in November 2023 when beating Helvic Dream; ground versatile but this a big ask on return to the level.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Paddy And Maureen Mullins Mares Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Vischio has really come good in the past week. She doesn't take a lot of work, so it managed to pan out in our favour. Once Danny [Mullins, jockey] was able to get her off at the start, I told him to keep holding on to her. She ran into a bit of trouble, but to her credit she was tough and gutsy and hit the line well. It's been a special 12 months, winning this race and winning granny's race at Cheltenham too.   Vischio won a Listed race on the Flat for Dick Donohoe, so if there is a Pattern race early in the season with cut in the ground she will probably take her chance, but today was the plan - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Start Your Racing TV Free Trial Now Finale Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Vischio has been through every dog-fight, every festival and it's only better she's getting. We had been running her on quick ground and took her out a few times on heavy ground because she is so light, but it's better she got when she got the real deep stuff. I was planning to run her over hurdles at Christmas. We might have to rethink now, but its a nice problem to have - Dick Donohoe, trainer

quotes.race: Play The Tote Exacta On Every Race Handicap
quotes.quote: She's improving away. I was positive on Vischio at Tramore and she's good and tough, it was the same again today. I got it handy, was able to fill her up when I wanted and kicked off the turn and there was no catching her. She loves these tight tracks - Mikey Sheehy, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Days like this don't come too often for someone like me so it's nice, very nice. Vischio had track form and I thought Mikey (Sheehy) was exceptional on her, poaching a lead and she was always going to hard to beat from there. We'll probably go for a mares' handicap hurdle in Galway - Dick Donohoe, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Tribal Star
runners.owner: Dooley Tbreds, J Fairhurst, Kabin Racing Synd, N Ohare

prev_owners.owner: Dooley T'breds, J Fairhurst, Kabin Racing Synd, N O'Hare

runners.comment: AW winner, 0-2 on turf, excellent effort at Newcastle latest, untried on quick ground
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-2 on turf; excellent effort in valuable 2m handicap at Newcastle in April off 86; 2lb higher here and has to prove effectiveness on quick ground (placed on soft for former yard); others appeal more.

runners.name: Zoffman
runners.comment: Course winner at 1m2f, not beaten far at that trip here latest, stamina a worry
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner is 2-23 on turf on the level; those wins came at 1m2f (here) and 1m4f back in 2022; not beaten that far over 1m2f here on latest eleven days ago but this trip may just stretch his stamina.

quotes.race: Leopardstown October Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I think going up in trip and getting on to easy ground has been a help to Zoffman. Today he even looked like getting further. He's very small and I thought with a low weight he had a great chance. You're always surprised when they win as easy as that, but you're probably getting a free 7lb with Jamie Powell. He jumps quite well but won't be going hurdling at this time anyway. I couldn't imagine he'd make a jumper being so small - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly Maiden
quotes.quote: Zoffman has run some very good races and it's only clear to us now that he wants ease in the ground, and maybe 1m4f. He really quickened for Dylan too. He might win a good handicap on soft ground - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Mr Percy
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, won Grade 2 over hurdles latest, 1m6f winner last Flat start, may go well
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; won a 1m6f Gowran maiden by 7l last September; has been hurdling since and won a Grade 2 Novice at Fairyhouse on last start in that sphere in April; unexposed on the Flat and rider takes off handy 5lb; could go well.

quotes.race: Paddy Kehoe Suspended Ceilings Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It's dry ground and Mr Percy didn't mind it. He travelled very well, he missed the last and he's done well to win. He's not a bad horse, he's a decent horse on the Flat. It was a nice bit of placing by the lads - J J Slevin, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing Again September 21st Maiden
quotes.quote: Mr Percy got it easy on the front end and he's a lovely, relaxed horse so I didn't want to break his momentum as he stays well. He stretched out well to the line and is a nice horse - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

8:00.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap

runners.name: Wish This
runners.comment: 0-6, ran well in defeat last season incl' here, yard had long-priced winner last week
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but ran well in defeat last season, including in a 6f maiden here on soft when a 5l fourth; went close in a 6f handicap at Navan (gd-yld) previously; 1m too far on seasonal return and yard had big-priced winner at Down Royal last week; could go well.

runners.name: Hugos Girl
runners.comment: Maiden is 0-5 on turf, beaten 5l when third here over 7f latest, drop in trip fine, claims
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden is 0-5 on turf but has shown improved form last two starts, over 6f at Dundalk and when a 5l third here over 7f (good) despite hanging left; drop back in trip is fine; claims from decent draw.

runners.name: Highbury See See
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, midfield in maidens at 7f-1m on AW and soft ground, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; midfield in three maidens at 7f-1m on AW and soft ground; quick ground an unknown but worth a market check dropped back in trip.

runners.name: Rion Rubette
runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, runner up twice at two, improved effort at Navan latest, down 5lb, chance
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf; finished runner up in first two starts last season; poor first two runs this term but better when beaten just 3.5l at Naas (5f, good) latest; dropped another 5lb and not without a chance back up at 6f.

runners.name: Withoutfurtherado
runners.comment: 0-7, has run well in defeat, may have needed latest, 4lb lower now, not discounted
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but has run well in defeat more than once; standout effort a 3l third of 9 in valuable nursery at Cork on final start of 2024 off 6lb higher; may have needed comeback run here last month; not discounted.

runners.name: Midnight Horizon
runners.comment: 0-4, modest form in maidens over further, drops in trip for handicap debut, best watched
runners.spotlight: 0-4; long odds and never threatened in maidens at 7f-10.5f on a variety of ground; best watched dropped back in trip for handicap debut.

runners.name: Sea Fort
runners.comment: 0-4 on turf, beaten similar distances in first two h'caps, down 6lb for latest, lacks run
runners.spotlight: Siyouni colt showed a glimmer of potential in first two handicaps at the backend of last season at Navan and Dundalk; handicapper giving him a chance but lacks a run and needs more to get his head in front.

runners.name: Annie Lavinia
runners.comment: Ten race maiden, 0-4 on turf, shaped like turn was near last twice, leading claims
runners.spotlight: 0-10 overall and 0-4 on turf; has run well on last two starts at Navan (6f, good) and then over 7f at Down Royal last week when narrowly denied in fourth; same mark here and drops back in trip; leading claims.

runners.name: Steel Magnolia
runners.comment: Didn't show much first three starts, much better on h'cap debut latest, up in trip, chance
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing in maidens but much more like it on handicap debut at Tipperary (5f, yielding) when keeping on for a 1.5l second behind Sarahmae (runs earlier on card); steps up in trip; leading chance off 1lb lower if handling quicker ground.

runners.name: James The Second
runners.comment: 0-14, went close at Gowran in April on heavy, not as good since, may need it softer
runners.spotlight: Exposed sort is 0-13 on turf; best effort a 0.75l second of 10 over 7f on heavy at Gowran in April; not as good back on quicker ground the last twice; may need softer conditions.

runners.name: Endless Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs S Field, Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt

prev_owners.owner: N W T Dalzell & Gary Devlin

runners.comment: Eleven race maiden, best form on the AW, beaten 7l on turf latest, needs more, 1lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Eleven race maiden is 0-6 on turf; has shown her best form on the AW; beaten 7l off 3lb higher over 7f at Fairyhouse on latest; 1lb wrong and needs more dropped back in trip.

runners.name: Petite Madame
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in four maidens at long odds, watch on h'cap debut unless backed, 1lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in four turf maidens at 6f-1m on variety of ground; handicap debutante is 1lb wrong and best watched unless money comes.

runners.name: Cooee Call
runners.comment: Modest form in maidens and similar in first h'cap latest, blinkers added, 4lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Showed little in three maidens at 6f-1m on the AW; no sign of improvement on turf and handicap debut here last month; blinkers now added to tongue tie; 4lb wrong and difficult to make a case for.

runners.name: Goddaughter
runners.comment: Beaten just two rivals in four maiden starts, hard to make a case for, 5lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Has beaten just two rivals home in four maidens on turf and AW at 6f-7f; 5lb wrong and hard to make a valid case for on handicap debut.

8:30.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap

runners.name: White Clover
runners.owner: James V Purcell & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Penalised for his pushed-out win at Listowel on Sunday; looks progressive
runners.spotlight: Finished a close fifth here before exploiting a good draw when pushed out to beat 12 rivals at Listowel on Sunday (6.5f, good to yielding); penalised accordingly but has only contested three handicaps and looks progressive.

quotes.race: Croom House Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: White Clover will probably run again, we will see what the handicapper does but the intention was to run her again. I took a little punt and put her in that Mallow handicap in three weeks and if she got in at the bottom of the weight she could have a little squeak over seven furlongs. We were hoping we would win today to get her into it. She has been threatening to be a good filly for a good few years now so we will find out shortly if she is or not - Joseph Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Verhoyen
runners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & M C Grassick

prev_owners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & M C Grassick
Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & M C Grassick
Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & Patrick Pearse

runners.comment: Six-time course winner but no better than ninth in this season's three races
runners.spotlight: Had lots of runs here and won six of them; however, no better than ninth in this season's three races so others appeal more.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap
quotes.quote: Verhoyen is competitive off this sort of mark and he wears his heart on his sleeve. We put the blinkers back on him today, the conditions suited him and I told Billy to ride him like it was a 6f race - Michael Grassick, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Verhoyen broke very quick today and he was gone. He's not that well-handicapped, so the fresh ground and the draw really came good for him - Michael Grassick, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Scurry Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm surprised how well Verhoyen stuck at it but he's well handicapped from what he's doing at home and on his two-year-old form in the Listed race. He's shown a level of ability but just hasn't been consistent. He just lost his way a bit last year but sometimes you see that with sprinters as three-year-olds. The Bold Lad could be a target for him. He only ran on Wednesday night so I'll give him a couple of easy weeks now. He deserves it - Michael Grassick, trainer.

quotes.race: Curragh Where Champions Are Made Handicap
quotes.quote: He hit the stalls right today. He has that level of ability that he's able to carry weight in these sort of handicaps and when nothing got to me at around half way I was still almost coasting away. I thought a little bit that the game might have been up when I was joined by the runner-up after being out on my own that long, but he's a clever old boy and was saving a little bit for himself and he dug deep when I needed him - Billy Lee, rider of Verhoyen

runners.name: Dagoda

prev_owners.owner: Shane Dowling & Shane Fleming & Jerry Enright

runners.comment: Again showed a liking for this track last year and she can show her form when fresh
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back course wins in maiden and handicap company in 2023 are her only victories in 34 races; again showed a liking for this track last year and she can show her form when fresh.

quotes.race: Bord Na Mona Recycling Maiden
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. Seamie was brilliant on Dagoda, we left him to his own devices. The new connections have bought her to breed in the new year so we'll run away with her for the autumn and see what else we get - Jennifer Lynch, trainer

runners.name: Glen Princess
runners.comment: Dual 1m winner but hasn't offered a great deal in handicaps and trying a new trip
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m at Gowran for Johnny Murtagh, in maiden and claiming company; hasn't offered a great deal in handicaps and this is her first attempt at sprinting.

quotes.race: Membership At Gowran Park Fillies & Mares Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Glen Princess has won here twice. She was finding it tough going in handicaps and this looked a winnable race if she ran up to her form - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Gordon Bennett
runners.breeder: Aj Groundworks Ltd & P F Kelly
runners.comment: Not won for a while but well handicapped and was bang there over C&D in April
runners.spotlight: Much lower in the weights than for his last win which came here in September 2022; below par on last two visits, though 7f was too far last time and he was bang there over C&D in April.

quotes.race: William Hill Joe McGrath Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We've decided that's it for the year for Gordon Bennett. He's had a great time and there is nothing left. These sprinters seem to get better with age and he's not heavily raced. We'll spend the winter building him up and he could just be stronger again. The great thing is that he's learning to behave a bit. Gary [Carroll] said he was never as calm as today and we noticed it in the yard too. A lot of the quirkiness might be going out of him - Dick Brabazon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sean Barrett Bloodstock Insurances Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Gordon Bennett has had a fair bit of bad luck since his last win. He should have won at the Curragh last month and should have won at Fairyhouse. He nearly always runs a race - Dick Brabazon, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Gordon Bennett was always a lovely horse and I asked Nathan to try and get some cover and he did it well. He settled beautifully and looking ahead we can manage him a bit now. He has a fair engine - Dick Brabazon, trainer.

runners.name: Secret Magician
runners.comment: Three-time winner who was fourth of 20 from 6lb out of the handicap over 7f here last time
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner who was fourth of 20 from 6lb out of the handicap over 7f here last time; 1lb higher for this but Wayne Hassett returns with his 5lb claim and he's fine over 6f.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Secret Magician was caught for a bit of toe at one stage, and he got stuck into him. He's as tough as nails - Martin Hassett, trainer.

runners.name: Velvet Skies
runners.comment: Good runs at Navan and the Curragh before getting too far back at Listowel on Sunday
runners.spotlight: Had some of these behind when placed at Navan and the Curragh (including White Clover) before getting too far back in the latter's race at Listowel last weekend; returning to a stiffer track is favourable and has to be shortlisted.

runners.name: Dynamic Force
runners.comment: Recent seconds were over further but a stiff 6f is acceptable
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-36; arrives here in form after seconds at Roscommon and Down Royal, latterly from a wide draw; those runs were over further but a stiff 6f is acceptable.

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Dynamic Force did it nicely. He was a bit laid-back so he took time to learn and adjust as the race progressed, but he's got a lovely big stride and is a horse who has a future. I'll have to talk to the Middleham Park team about plans and we might just feel our way gradually and have a bigger target towards the end of the year or we could pitch him in somewhere nicer next time, but we'll see how he is. He's an exciting horse, but he's still got a bit to learn and is a bit raw. He'd shown enough at home, plenty to be honest, but he's so laid-back, which was a little concern of mine and that's maybe why he was a longer price than he should have been. I think he's more 6f than 5f and he may get further next year; his stride is quite eyecatching and he seems to do everything effortlessly as you could see with Danny, who didn't have to give him any urgings. He's a Kodiac with a good, strong, powerful action and I think he'd get through easier ground as well; extremes of either ground would not be right - Robert Cowell, trainer.

runners.name: Showhound

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Promising second here on yard debut but only ninth next time and now blinkered
runners.spotlight: Turf/AW winner in Britain at up to 7f; narrowly held over 7f here on debut for this yard but was a weakening ninth on his return visit; now blinkered; effective at 6f.

runners.name: Catherine Chroi
runners.breeder: Manister House, N Anderton & P Leonard
runners.comment: Two good runs over 6f before finding 5f too sharp at Navan; needs considering
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner who returned to form with good runs here and at Naas (both over 6f) before finding 5f too sharp a test at Navan; goes on all ground and, returned to 6f, she could go well if not hampered by a low draw.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Catherine Chroi is a tough little filly and very consistent. She rarely runs a bad race so hopefully she can go out and win again at some point. It's harder to win in Ireland than it is here, but she enjoys being trained with us and we're picking the right type of races for her. She's thriving - Iain Jardine, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's thriving and I hope she can stay on an upward curve. She was rated 41 when she joined us and she's won six times and shot right up to 75. But I still think she can win off her new mark. She's getting stronger and ran well in a good race at Ayr last time, doing her best work at the end. The Bronze Cup at that venue could be a good target. She needs a wee bit of give in the ground and if there's no pace she has to go on herself. 26-07-24

runners.name: Tawaazon
runners.comment: Running well and was only 2l behind in White Clover's race at Listowel on Sunday
runners.spotlight: Snapped a losing run at Naas (6f, good) last month and from midfield was only 2l behind in White Clover's race at Listowel on Sunday; yet another with each-way claims in his current form.

runners.name: Altimara
runners.comment: Maiden whose best efforts have come on the AW and over 7f
runners.spotlight: Maiden whose best efforts have come on the AW and over 7f; outpaced over 6f at Naas latest; others preferred.

runners.name: Nouvel Espoir
runners.owner: Ms Yvonne Hennessy & Ms S Oneill
runners.comment: Speedy 5yo whose two wins have come at 5f and 6f could be a stretch on this stiff track
runners.spotlight: Speedy 5yo whose two wins have come at 5f and 6f could be a stretch on this stiff track; ran moderately on final sighting in October.

quotes.race: Junction Gastro Bar & Guesthouse Handicap
quotes.quote: Nouvel Espoir had a good run at the Curragh last day. I thought if he could cope with the early speed he could take beating. I think he could be capable of winning again - Ben Coen, rider

quotes.race: Navan Handicap
quotes.quote: Nouvel Espoir came on nicely from the first day. Dylan gave him a brilliant ride and hopefully he can stay going forward - Jim Barcoe, trainer.

runners.name: Aurora Nova
runners.comment: Overcame a slow start to win at Bellewstown; soft ground a feasible excuse last time
runners.spotlight: 6f winner last summer and overcame a slow start to win over 5f at Bellewstown this April; only 4lb higher here and soft ground was a feasible excuse at Navan last time.

runners.name: Twotolose
runners.comment: Third behind White Clover in a 5f maiden in October but hasn't progressed from there
runners.spotlight: Close third behind White Clover in a 5f maiden in October but hasn't progressed from there and handicap debut two runs back was nothing to get carried away about.

runners.name: Kwa Herini
runners.comment: Only had the six races and the best of those was when a close fourth of 15 over C&D
runners.spotlight: Only had the six races and the best of those was when a close fourth of 15 over C&D on good ground two runs back; below that level next time but clearly has races in her.

runners.name: Run Forrest Run
runners.comment: Close up behind Dynamic Force at Down Royal despite losing lengths at the start
runners.spotlight: The winner of six races on turf, one of them here; early days with this yard and finished hot on the heels of Dynamic Force at Down Royal despite losing lengths at the start; has to be considered.

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap
quotes.quote: Run Forrest Run jumped well and got plenty of cover early, as he can be a bit keen. Everything went to plan - Conor Stone-Walsh, rider.

quotes.race: NB Builders Merchants Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Run Forrest Run did it well enough, I was getting a bit lonely out in front a furlong out and with three quarters to go I thought oh no but he responded well. I think if something had come to me, he may have just stuck his neck out again. - Jack Mitchell, rider

runners.name: Saturn Seven
runners.comment: Very nearly won off 3lb higher over C&D in October; hit traffic on comeback run
runners.spotlight: Dual winner; hit traffic on her reappearance a month ago and she very nearly won off 3lb higher over C&D in October; one to consider with Colin Keane booked.

runners.name: Rosato
runners.comment: Signed off last season in fine form and could strip fitter for her comeback run
runners.spotlight: Signed off last season with two 6f wins at Navan on either side of a below-par run here on soft ground; ran okay back here on her return from a break and could be interesting if stripping fitter this time; 6lb above last winning mark but she had a good bit in hand that day.

quotes.race: Book Your Discounted Tickets On NavanRacecourse.ie Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Rosato got a bit stuck on the rail at the Curragh and I'd say she was still a bit green as well, it was probably her first time trying to take a gap going forwards rather than backwards. We thought she would win today and we put her in on Monday at Roscommon because we thought she might win and might need to go under a penalty - Charles Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Zaragoza
runners.comment: Won this 12 months ago and returns on the back of an encouraging run at Navan
runners.spotlight: Only 3lb higher when beating 18 rivals in this race 12 months ago (first-time cheekpieces) and returns on the back of a running-on third at Navan; good chance.

runners.name: Ukiyo
runners.comment: Promise in sprint maidens and now making handicap debut for Gavin Cromwell
runners.spotlight: Didn't run at all badly in any of her four sprint maidens for previous yard and now making handicap debut for Gavin Cromwell; well worth a market check.

runners.name: Gegenpressing
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Got no luck here last time after winning at Sligo the run before (6f, good)
runners.spotlight: Got no luck here last time after winning at Sligo the run before (6f, good); seems in fair form and this mark isn't beyond him.

quotes.race: Tote Never Beaten By SP Handicap
quotes.quote: Gegenpressing loves these summer tracks and all four of his wins have come right-handed. I thought he got there too soon but he held on and, with a bit of luck, he might pick up another one or two off the marks he'll be off - Patrick Harty, joint trainer.

runners.name: Purring Along
runners.comment: Only 3-35 and the wins have come over 7f+ on slow ground; this looks an insufficient test
runners.spotlight: Only 3-35 and the wins have come over 7f+ on slow ground; this looks an insufficient test; new trainer.

quotes.race: Galway Handicap
quotes.quote: PURRING ALONG was working the best she's ever worked the past week. We brought her up to the beach the other day and I don't think I've ever seen a horse so fresh so it was a good omen coming into today. She got a little nick one day out in the paddock so she hasn't ran in a few weeks. Easy ground and a good pace suits - Shane Duffy, trainer.

runners.name: Jacks Inn
runners.comment: Only had the four races but was well down the field on his handicap debut (6f, good; 22-1)
runners.spotlight: Only had the four races but was well down the field on his handicap debut (6f, good; 22-1).

runners.name: Dark Willow
runners.comment: Improved for a tongue-tie last time but over further and she's 9lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: 0-11; improved for the tongue-tie to be fourth of 15 at Roscommon but that was over a fair bit further and she's 9lb out of the weights for this.

runners.name: Stream Of Stars
runners.comment: Made all last time for a fifth success over hurdles; sure to give it another good go
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with two Fontwell wins (2m3f/2m1f) last autumn and started this season in good style when making all at Bangor (2m, good) in May, providing Nigel & Willy Twiston-Davies with their first winner together; bound to give it another good go.

quotes.race: Bangor-On-Dee Family Fun Day Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stream Of Stars is very consistent and has been coming down the weights. Sam [Twiston-Davies] gave him a lovely ride. He's ground-versatile and had been coming back into form at home recently, and the drop into this kind of race was key - Willy Twiston-Davies, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Kilburn Gaels Hurling Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stream Of Stars had a long time off and the owners have been very patient, because I promise you we've probably given him eight entries and he's never once been declared. There's been a lot of patience shown all round and it's paid off. He had a leg, and then recovered from that and was just coming back into training at possibly the wrong time. I thought stepping up to two miles and three on his first run back possibly wasn't ideal but luckily he got a nice slot in behind the leader and it was a nice even pace. He relaxed and jumped - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Luttrell Lad
runners.comment: Won at Taunton in February and ran well last time; strong contender
runners.spotlight: Races prominently; capitalised on reduced mark at Taunton (2m, good to soft) in February and it was a good effort when fourth in a valuable series final at Haydock (1m7f, good) in April; strong contender off the same mark.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Luttrell Lad is nice. He had very good bumper form and it was nice to get him started off over hurdles. He can be a bit fizzy but we went a good gallop there and it allowed him to settle and jump well. Day one is out of the way now and there's plenty to look forward to - Tom O'Brien, jockey.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Luttrell Lad was very green at Stratford first time. He learned a lot and he kept on well here - Richard Johnson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's gone for a winter break and will be back in the spring but he's a good horse for us. We got him handicapped on the Flat [75] and his last run was probably just one too many. 08-11-22
