He's been a decent horse for us, winning over hurdles as well as running a cracker when eighth in the County Hurdle at the festival in March. I was happy enough with his reappearance effort at Haydock last month and then he looked like he was going to win at Hereford on Saturday but got caught late on having started racing way too soon. Unfortunately he's been plagued with problems; he's got a suppressed immune response without a shadow of a doubt and has been very difficult to train. As a result he'll never achieve what he possibly could have done. He's incredibly genuine and a lot of horses wouldn't have faced the bridle suffering what he's been through. He's had to have constant treatment and the owners have had to be so patient - for them it's like owning two horses in training as he has to have constant physio. I'd still like to think he has a nice handicap in him, but he's a mystery. I don't know if he'd stay as far as 3m. When we first got him we thought he'd be a real speed merchant who'd want top of the ground, but he's not as fast as he thinks he is. 20-12-23

runners.name: War Lord
runners.comment: Looked to be finding his level until a lesser run 195 days ago; had wind surgery since
runners.spotlight: 10yo who's on a long losing run but there were signs he was finding his level in the autumn until a lesser effort at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) when last seen 195 days ago; had wind surgery in April; yard likely has better prospects with American Land but market can guide.

quotes.race: Cazoo Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think War Lord is getting better. He can step up in trip when we need to but on this ground we don't need to yet. He's got two options at Cheltenham; the Arkle or the Turners. He's earned his right to be there but we might enter him up for Doncaster on Saturday [Lightning Novices' Chase] before that just in case that race cuts up - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Durdar Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: War Lord jumped well for a second run over fences and we quite like him. He probably waited for a bit of company late on and was bound to get a little tired on that ground, but he stuck his head down when he needed to. The race panned out really well and it's nice he's had a proper race today. Over hurdles it looked like he probably wanted a bit of a trip but for the moment you'd probably keep him over two miles - Brendan Powell, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Only Bettor Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: War Lord is a progressive young horse. We were delighted with his run at Wetherby and he's settled better today. He was tough as it's a long straight here - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a great horse for the yard and he's knocking on the door again. His day will come and the handicapper has given him a chance but I don't think he'll ever be the force of old. 07-11-24

He's had a wind operation and ran really well in the Haldon Gold Cup, although we're just struggling to find his novice chase form. He's on a mark he should be capable of winning off and we'll probably sidestep the big festivals, but I'm optimistic he can win a nice 0-145 or 0-150. 18-01-24

runners.name: American Land
runners.comment: On a hat-trick having won here (2m2f, good) three weeks ago; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Likes to press the pace; turning into a prolific sort having won four of his last five, the last two after wind surgery and most recently here (about 2m2f, good) three weeks ago; sometimes makes hard work of it but that's not doing his mark any harm and he should go well again up 4lb; yard also runs War Lord.

stable_tour.quote: He had a wind operation last week, which should help him. It's something that was in the back of our minds as he looked to stop in his races last season and again in his race at Exeter last month. He's a nice horse who will be back for the turn of the year and, as he's a light horse and likes decent ground, he should have a good spring campaign. 10-11-23

A chaser for the future as he's a big, strong horse. He was a bit disappointing last time but stopped quickly. We've given him a wind operation and he's got a mark of 108, which I think would make him thrown in. He wouldn't mind a bit of decent ground, so he'll be ready to run at the end of the month and I think he's really well handicapped. He's quite a nice horse. 18-01-24

runners.name: Balboa
runners.comment: Useful juvenile hurdler but it's been a struggle since and he's been poor the last twice
runners.spotlight: Useful juvenile hurdler but it's been mostly hard work since, including when beaten a long way in cheekpieces the last twice; meets some in-form rivals today and this looks a tough race to stage revival; drops back in trip.

quotes.race: Champion Hats Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's taken a while for the penny to drop. Balboa has had two runs but he still had a look at the first (hurdle). We got a bit of good fortune with the non-runners but that's racing and you've got to kick the ball when it's in front of you. He's ok and he's solid, he seems to handle the soft ground. We might turn up at the Cheltenham meeting in November, although we do have some higher rated who could go there. Milton Harris, trainer

runners.name: Get The Value
runners.comment: On a hat-trick; further 7lb rise demands more but he's thriving and must go well
runners.spotlight: Positively ridden when having rivals well strung out at Stratford (2m) in March and again always up there when doubling up off 9lb higher here (about 2m2f, also good) three weeks ago; further 7lb rise demands more but he's thriving.

runners.name: Clearance

prev_owners.owner: Kildonan Gold Racing 2 & I J Jardine

runners.comment: Loves it here and showed much more last time; strong gallop looks likely which is a plus
runners.spotlight: Six-time course winner on good ground (2m1f-2m2f); woeful in two starts away from this track in the spring but he'd dropped to a dangerous mark when a respectable fourth here (about 2m5f, good; winner's won since) last month; will appreciate a strong gallop on this drop back in trip and can rarely be ruled out here.

quotes.race: Don't Miss The Newton Abbot Country Show Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clearance is absolutely incredible here. He's got so much speed, and Tom [Cannon] rides him with such confidence because of that. He beat a fresh four-year-old as well. I'm not sure when the next race here is but he'll be back - Michael Blake, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Live Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: They got racing quite early which helped Clearance, as they were slowing up in the last furlong - Hector Crouch, jockey.

3:05.race_name: Visit The Wellbeing Show Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Thank You Blue
runners.comment: 0-6 over fences and pulled up when last seen in this sphere; has questions to answer
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over fences and his jumping has been an issue; not seen in this sphere since pulled up at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) in February but appreciated a subsequent return to hurdles, winning twice in the spring; couldn't take advantage of a good opportunity in a Clonmel claimer last time, though, and has a question to answer back over fences, despite his lower chase mark.

quotes.race: JTC Pizzalicious Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thank You Blue jumped really well. He'll probably be better over a little bit further, I was just forcing him for the last half a mile. He was good over the last two and galloped to the line - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We managed to get this lovely big rangy horse out for one run last term in a Wincanton bumper, where he ran a smashing race in what looked like a very hot contest. That was over 1m7f, but he has plenty of stamina and we will try and get another bumper into him next, although he is still around six or seven weeks off his return. I look on him as a medium-term project as you will not really see him at his best until he is seven or eight years old. 09-11-22

runners.name: Fever Dream
runners.owner: Bedford & Noel & The Cant Say No
runners.comment: In form but his last run was over 3m5f and this sharp drop in trip is not certain to suit
runners.spotlight: 1-8 over fences, the win coming two starts back at Southwell (nearly 3m2f; had wind surgery) and it was a respectable effort when third in the Norfolk National at Fakenham (3m5f, also good) 29 days ago; not certain to be suited by this sharp drop back in trip.

runners.name: The Dream Goes On
runners.breeder: Dr Rdp Newland & Mr G Farmiloe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Kate Farmiloe And Mrs L J Newland

runners.comment: Won in April but fell two starts ago and jumped carefully last time; cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: Best form when winning on her chase debut at Plumpton (about 2m4f, good) in April but she fell at Market Rasen a fortnight later and looked to be remembering that when jumping carefully at Hereford 26 days ago, eventually pulled up; all of her dam's four wins came in cheekpieces and she's not ruled out with that aid now deployed.

runners.name: Limerick Leader
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Nicolas Taudon
runners.comment: Lost his form when last seen over fences and ran no race over hurdles at Plumpton in March
runners.spotlight: Lost his form over fences after finishing second at Musselburgh (about 2m4f, soft) over a year ago and has been kept to hurdling since joining this yard; some fair efforts were rather overshadowed when he ran no race at Plumpton (about 3m1f, good) three months ago, though; hard to know what to expect on his return to this sphere.

quotes.race: Terry Frame Joiners And Glaziers Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When the other horse came to Limerick Leader, he pulled out more. He was very green in front - we didn't want to be there, it was just the way it panned out. He's a really good type and we like him. We'll keep going with him for a wee while - Rose Dobbin, trainer.

runners.name: Culligran
runners.comment: Warm in the market and encouraging second on chase debut last month; big player
runners.spotlight: Comfortably won over hurdles off a similar mark at Hereford (about 2m1f, good to soft) in November; warm in the market when an encouraging second on her chase debut at Ffos Las (2m, good) 13 days ago, looking like a step up in trip could do the trick; gets that today and surely goes well.

runners.name: Pooroldmackley
runners.comment: Won over C&D (heavy) and scored over hurdles (good) next time; chance, despite higher mark
runners.spotlight: Won in the mud over C&D in April and was a wide-margin winner over hurdles at Hereford (2m4f, good) three days later, proving he doesn't need testing conditions; 10lb higher mark much more of an issue, as it was when third over hurdles at Ludlow last month; should still be in the mix.

runners.name: Mistletoe
runners.comment: Second in a mares' novices hurdle (2m5f, good) but has a bit to prove after latest effort.
runners.spotlight: Won a point bumper last November (soft); showed little on her first two rules starts before improving to be 6l second in a Fontwell mares' novices' hurdle (2m5f, good) in April; failed to back that up at Worcester (2m4f, good) latest, giving her a bit to prove again.

runners.name: Portobello Girl
runners.comment: Improved recently; won 3m2f hurdle latest; up 3lb; unexposed; could have more to come.
runners.spotlight: Has improved recently and broke her duck at Stratford (3m2f, good) last month; up 3lb for that, unexposed and could have more to come.

runners.name: Chabadatika

prev_owners.owner: Salomon Taieb, David Dahan & M Seror

runners.comment: 2m1f and 2m3f hurdle winner; good effort here (2m5f) latest; bit to prove over this trip.
runners.spotlight: 2m1f and 2m3f hurdle winner; well beaten second at Taunton (3m, good to firm) in April but fared better here (2m5f, good) latest; not ruled out but she does have a bit to prove over his trip.

runners.name: My Louise
runners.comment: Bumper winner; wind surgery since well beaten at Chepstow (2m7f) latest; better is needed.
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner (first two starts); has so far been unable to improve on that form over hurdles; has had wind surgery since well beaten at Chepstow (2m7f, good) latest; better is needed.

runners.name: Inchagoill Lady

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Pickard, John Middleton & Edd Yeo

runners.comment: 3m hurdle winner; below that level over 2m2f latest but the return to further should suit.
runners.spotlight: Well supported when scoring at Taunton (3m, good to firm) on penultimate start, her first after wind surgery; went up 5lb for that; couldn't match that effort when dropped back to 2m2f here latest; drops 1lb and the return to further should suit; player.

quotes.race: Lucia Stevens Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We had hit the crossbar with Inchagoill Lady a few times so we're delighted to see her win. The wind op has done her the world of good and she handled the quicker ground well. Lewis [Saunders] gave her a great ride and he has impressed us when we have used him. His 7lb claim definitely helps with the handicappers - Kevin Pickard, trainer.

runners.name: Arctic Angel
runners.comment: Third in a bumper here (good) and in a 2m3f hurdle (heavy); this longer trip may help.
runners.spotlight: Third in a mares' bumper here (good) on debut last year; unable to improve on that level of form but was third over hurdles at Chepstow (2m3f, heavy) in January; below that level twice since; half-sister to a 3m winner, so this longer trip might see her find some improvement.

runners.name: All Under Control
runners.comment: Close second over C&D latest; needs to back that up and she's a player if able to do so.
runners.spotlight: 2m5f hurdle winner (soft) last December, when with Robert Walford; form then tailed off; back in better form for this trainer last month, equalling her best RPR when a close second over C&D (good); now needs to back that up and she's a player if able to do so.

runners.name: Elfride
runners.comment: 2m7f hurdle winner; below par on her last five starts; winning mark but plenty to prove.
runners.spotlight: 2m7f hurdle winner (good to soft) in May 2023; well below par on her last five starts; blinkers now accompany tongue-tie; back on her winning mark but plenty to prove.

runners.name: Share A Moment
runners.comment: Point winner whose two attempts over hurdles have offered little encouragement.
runners.spotlight: Fast-ground point winner whose two attempts over hurdles have offered little encouragement.

4:35.race_name: Book Our Winning Post Restaurant Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Karannelle
runners.comment: C&D winner; below par last two starts of last season; competitive mark if she is ready.
runners.spotlight: Has won three times here, including over C&D; below par on her last two starts of last season; yet to win when fresh but has run well after a break; on a competitive mark if she is ready.

quotes.race: Newton Abbot Racecourse Conference Centre Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Karanelle has been coming down in the weights, which has obviously helped. She is what she is, but the weight has told.  She'll go up and it'll be hard work again, but it was a masterclass ride from James [Bowen]. He was ultra cool and she was up in distance - David Rees, trainer.

quotes.race: Family Fun Raceday Today Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She's very small and her jumping needs to improve a bit, she did improve from the first day though. She's a bit inconsistent with her jumping but has a good jump in her, as well as having a great cruising speed. She quickened up well but it was a very moderate mares' race, she's hopefully open to more improvement though. She has form on the Flat over 6f and 7f so when she gets her jumping a bit slicker and sharper she'll be alright - Robbie Power, rider of Karannelle

runners.name: Whispering Royal
runners.comment: 2m hurdle winner; has slid to a handy mark if revived but he has a bit to prove.
runners.spotlight: 1m AW Flat winner and 2m hurdle winner; not ground dependent; sliding in the weights after three below-par efforts this year; handy mark if revived but there's a bit to prove at present.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whispering Royal got an easy lead and put his experience from Wincanton to good use. I'm not sure how much depth there was to the race, we'll find out in a few weeks' time, but he didn't do anything wrong - Tom Cannon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running with promise on the Flat and I was keen to get him started over hurdles earlier this month at Chepstow until all the rain came. Soft ground will be fine but I didn't want to start him on heavy. He's a straightforward horse and we should have a lot of fun with him. He may make his hurdling debut at Wincanton on Sunday. 25-10-23
I hope we'll have some fun with him over hurdles as he's shown promise on the Flat, and he started by finishing third at Wincanton last month. That experience will bring him on plenty. 10-11-23

runners.name: John Betjeman

prev_owners.owner: Robin Gillard, Rory Gillard, Tim Seegar

runners.comment: C&D winner in April; below par latest; each-way claims if he can bounce back.
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner on slow ground, including over C&D (raced prominently in first-time visor) in April; below par at Ffos Las (2m, good) latest, after a 5lb rise; each-way claims if he can bounce back.

quotes.race: Thatchers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: John Betjeman is terrible in front but he's game and we're lucky to have him. There's been a few seconds and he's been unlucky in life, but he's run 75 times and won more than 70,000GBP in prize money, so we feel fortunate to have him around. He's been incredibly sound, we've never had a problem with him, and he'll be out in the paddock before he goes to bed. He's an amazing horse and we're delighted he's done it. My son Fergus rang me up and mentioned the visor. We've had the blinkers on and off to keep him sweet but luckily it worked. We had a bottle of champagne after he won and we'll be getting another! -  Mark Gillard, trainer.

runners.name: Seraphic
runners.comment: 2m1f hurdle winner; solid recent form; each-way player if reproducing best effort of 2025.
runners.spotlight: Won a claiming hurdle (2m1f, soft) when trained in France; in solid form under both codes in recent months, winning on the Flat (1m2f, good to firm) in April; each-way claims if able to reproduce best hurdles effort of 2025.

runners.name: Mach Ten
runners.comment: Early days in handicaps; 2lb drop; each-way chance on his return from wind surgery.
runners.spotlight: Placed at up to 2m3f over hurdles; acts on good or slower; still relatively early days in handicaps; 2lb drop; looks to have an each-way chance on his return from wind surgery.

runners.name: Gore Point
runners.comment: Bumper winner who's been disappointing over hurdles; handy mark and not written off.
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground bumper winner last season who has so far disappointed over hurdles; has had wind surgery since last seen in February; if that has helped, he's on a handy mark based on that bumper success; not written off.

stable_tour.quote: He runs at Taunton on Thursday. He's been forward-going and will make up into a nice novice hurdler this season. He loves a bit of good ground so we're cracking on with him while we can. 14-11-24

runners.name: Colonel Lesley
runners.comment: C&D winner; placed here twice last summer; goes well fresh; competitive mark; contender.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who was placed here twice last summer; has twice won when fresh and returns on a very competitive mark; has left Alan Jones and returned to one of his former trainers; likely contender.

runners.name: Hill Station
runners.comment: 1m4f AW winner; 0-9 over hurdles and finished last on his return to this code latest.
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner at up to 1m4f; 0-9 over hurdles and finished last on his return to this code on latest start.

runners.name: For You Buzz
runners.comment: Fourth here latest and needs to improve on what we have seen so far to take a hand.
runners.spotlight: Finished 11l behind the reopposing John Betjeman when fourth here latest and needs to improve on what we have seen so far to take a hand.

runners.name: Liberty Looming
runners.comment: Unplaced in 16 attempts across both codes; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in 16 attempts across both codes; others preferred.

runners.name: Miss Marette
runners.comment: Returns to hurdles after well beaten in several chases; blinkered now; plenty to prove.
runners.spotlight: 2m hurdle winner on fast ground; returns to this discipline after being well beaten in several chases; blinkers go on; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Knights Affair
runners.comment: Won a weak maiden hurdle on his debut in this sphere; more needed under a penalty.
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner at up to 2m on fast ground; won a weak-looking Huntingdon maiden (2m4f, good) on his hurdling debut; this slightly longer trip looks positive; can improve for that initial experience and will probably need to with a penalty to shoulder.

quotes.race: PricedUp Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Knights Affair a lovely, big, raw individual. He had a fair few races when he was trained on the Flat, but he's still a bit of a baby. This was a great start and all he's going to do is improve. That was a nice introduction and he'll run throughout the summer. We're all very hopeful about him - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

runners.name: Chief Black Robe
runners.comment: Dual 2m5f chase winner here; 0-9 over hurdles; bit to prove after a 15-month absence.
runners.spotlight: Dual winner around the equivalent trip here over fences (best chasing RPR 125; stays 3m); unplaced in nine hurdles starts; not seen since pulled up in a hunter chase 15 months ago; returns with a bit to prove.

runners.name: Highway Hero
runners.comment: Last seen winning a 2m4f conditions point; joined this good yard since; market check.
runners.spotlight: 1-16 in points; 0-2 under rules; won a 2m4f conditions point last month and has since joined this good yard; likely to need improvement; check the market for any clues.

runners.name: Keel Strand
runners.comment: Showed promise on hurdles debut; had wind surgery since latest; could get back on track.
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on his hurdles debut last December (2m4f, good to soft); reported to have made a respiratory noise when unable to improve at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) in February; returns after wind surgery, drops slightly in trip and wears a tongue-tie; no surprise if he gets back on track.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky not to win his only Irish point-to-point and we bought him shortly after at the Goffs Punchestown Sale. He disappointed on his Chepstow bumper debut last month, but he's not your typical bumper horse in that he's a staying type who'll need a trip now he goes over hurdles. 04-11-24

runners.name: Locked Down Lad
runners.comment: 18-1 for hurdles debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good) last month, when tailed off; more needed.
runners.spotlight: Point bumper winner; well beaten in an Exeter bumper on his rules debut last year; 18-1 for hurdles debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good) last month, when tailed off; much more needed.

runners.name: Mr Daytona
runners.comment: 50-1 for debut when always behind at Plumpton (2m, good) last month; tongue-tie goes on.
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to hurdle winner Our Pink Lady; dam unplaced bumpers/hurdles; 50-1 for debut when always behind at Plumpton (2m, good) last month; tongue-tie goes on.

runners.name: Oval Street
runners.comment: Triple point winner; placed over C&D but will need significant improvement to win this.
runners.spotlight: Triple point winner on a sound surface; placed three times at up to 2m5f over hurdles, including C&D; needs significant improvement to win this.

2:35.race_name: Join Us On Ladies' Night Novices' Handicap Chase

runners.name: Backinaction
runners.comment: Poor in two starts over fences and not seen since September; watch the market
runners.spotlight: Irish maiden point winner who is 0-5 over hurdles and was well held when unseating two out on chase debut over C&D last August, then beaten 26l at Worcester (2m7f, also good; jumped poorly) ten days later; dropped a total of 10lb for those runs but not seen since; only of interest if the market says so.

runners.name: Illogical Logic
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Voir Sca & Mr Joel Denis
runners.comment: Looked the winner until falling over shorter here last week; big player if he stays
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden (0-8 chasing); found to be lame when disappointing at Southwell in February but was all set to win his first race when 12l clear then falling two out here (2m5f, good) one week ago; stamina to prove over this extended trip but he has obvious claims off the same mark.

runners.name: Grand Sabre
runners.comment: Went in at the second time of asking over fences and this longer trip's a plus; big shout
runners.spotlight: Nothing to show for seven previous runs but he popped up in a small field when staying on strongly at Warwick (3m, good; 22-1) last time, with Moonlight Artist well adrift; that was just his second run over fences and his jumping was noticeably better; probably has more to offer, particularly over this sort of trip.

runners.name: Moonlight Artist
runners.owner: The Cheltenham & South West Racing Club
runners.comment: Flopped behind Grand Sabre last time; possibilities if he can bounce back
runners.spotlight: Back in good nick when fitted with a tongue tie for his two outings in April, latterly when battling on gamely for narrow win at Warwick (3m); flopped over that C&D (also good) behind Grand Sabre last month, when his jumping lacked fluency; question to answer now but possibilities if he can bounce back.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Moonlight Artist has gone off favourite or a short price a few times and I've always wondered why but he got it together today. This should do his confidence the world of good and hopefully there should be another race in him. Brendan Powell, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was in training all of last season and ready to run but we didn't want to risk him on the ground. He'll go novice hurdling in the middle of November but works nicely. He seems like a nice horse. 31-10-22

runners.name: Tellairsue
runners.comment: Fell on chase debut here one week ago and he wasn't looking the likely winner at the time
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Fontwell (3m2f, good) in April 2023 and was a close second at Ludlow (2m5f, good) two months ago; however, he'd dropped to the rear when falling on last week's chase debut here (2m5f, good); Illogical Logic was skipping along merrily in the lead at the time so he probably has work to do.

runners.name: Radharc Na Slaine
runners.comment: Would have finished behind Illogical Logic here last week but this longer trip will help
runners.spotlight: Disputing third and staying on when he fell over C&D last August and he inherited third (eventually kept on for second) when Illogical Logic fell here (2m5f, also good) one week ago; this longer trip will help.

5:05.race_name: Visit Our Classic Car Show Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Alba Crus
runners.comment: Led over 1f out before being run out of the places late on his debut; sets a fair standard
runners.spotlight: 55,000euros 3yo; half-brother to five winners, notably Kolossal (European 1m2f-1m4f including Group 3; RPR 110); 3-1, led over 1f out before being run out of the places in the final strides at Uttoxeter (good) ten days ago; sets a fair standard and should improve.

runners.name: Diegos Icon
runners.breeder: R Lycett Green & Mrs R Beckett
runners.comment: £7,000 3yo; yard has the occasional bumper winner but 0-30 in them over last five seasons
runners.spotlight: 3,000gns yearling, £7,000 3yo; sixth foal; brother to 1m6f winner Self Inflicted Sid (RPR 85), half-brother to 1m6f AW (76) and 2m hurdle winner Gripper; dam 1m4f winner (87); yard has the occasional bumper winner but is 0-30 in them over the last five seasons.

runners.name: Mariniere
runners.comment: Yard is 1-33 in bumpers over the last five seasons; market can be informative.
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam placed 7f AW (RPR 68), half-sister to UAE 7f/1m Group 2 winner Safety Check, out of unraced half-sister to 1m2f 2yo Group 1 winner Marchand De Sable; yard is 1-33 in bumpers over the last five seasons; market can be informative.

runners.name: Usyk
runners.comment: 15,000euros 3yo; good jumps family; stable should always be respected in bumpers
runners.spotlight: 15,000euros 3yo; sixth foal; half-brother to bumper/2m hurdle winner Raven Rule; dam point winner, half-sister to smart 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner The Minack and useful 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Definity, out of Irish Grand National winner Ebony Jane; yard can ready one and is always to be respected in this sort of contest.

runners.name: Little Lady Rock
runners.comment: 3,000euros 3yo; yard is 0-18 in bumpers but she's worth a market check
runners.spotlight: 3,000euros 3yo; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Wewillgowithplanb (2m-2m2f hurdle/chase) and Big Bad Bear (bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to high-class bumper and 2m-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Invitation Only; yard is 0-18 in bumpers but she's worth a market check.

runners.name: Masked Mistress
runners.comment: Yard is 0-22 in bumpers the last five seasons but Harry Cobden booked; watch the market
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to French 14.5f winner Mademoiselle As; dam unraced half-sister to 1m7f Flat and smart 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner Saturnas; stable 0-22 in bumpers over the last five seasons but Harry Cobden's an interesting booking; market can guide.

runners.name: Spent A Fortune
runners.comment: Trainer is 1-22 in bumpers but she's related to plenty of bumper winners; betting helpful
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam bumper (second start) and 2m3f-3m hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Oscar Rock (smart bumper and 2m4f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Athenean (bumper/2m hurdle); trainer is 1-22 in bumpers but she's bred to make her mark in this sphere.

4:22.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 3.52, 4.22, 4.55 & 5.30 +6yds)

runners.name: Boyfriend
runners.comment: Nearly made all at Newbury on return from 12-month absence; big player back down in grade
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo; nearly made all at Newbury (1m, good to firm) 18 days ago on return from 12-month absence, collared by a progressive rival only close home; big player back down in grade, assuming he doesn't bounce.

runners.name: Metallo
runners.comment: Hindered by racing alone last time; possibilities off current mark at this level
runners.spotlight: Placed a few times on AW during the winter; not in the same form since but was hindered by racing alone at Newmarket most recently (wore blinkers, now goes in visor); possibilities off current mark at this level.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice three-year-old who had a setback in the spring and has been gelded since his last start. He showed a good level of form as a two-year-old, beating Dancing Gemini at Salisbury on his second start. He'll be racing this winter on the all-weather. 10-10-24

runners.name: Thyer
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who ran well in first-time cheekpieces over C&D most recently; respected
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo; posted two duck eggs in UAE this year but has largely progressive form on British soil; ran well in first-time cheekpieces over C&D (good to firm) most recently; respected in the retained headgear.

runners.name: Madame De Sevigne
runners.comment: Quirky filly but registered a Newmarket success the last time Oisin Murphy was on board
runners.spotlight: Quirky filly who has a slight doubt over current form but is fairly useful on her day and registered a Newmarket success the last time Oisin Murphy was on board; both wins over 7f but appears to stay 1m.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a nice race to win and Oisin said this would be Madame Sevigne's best trip when he rode her first time this year. I think we'll put her away for the year - Robert Eddery, trainer.

runners.name: Desperate Dan
runners.comment: Best form on heavy going; chance depends on what the weather does
runners.spotlight: Best form on heavy going at Nottingham (won comfortably) and Windsor (went close) last autumn; beaten long way returned to good ground on reappearance; chance depends on what the weather does.

runners.name: Quiet Resolve
runners.comment: Yet to win on turf and latest effort doesn't augur well; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Both wins on Newcastle AW; has bits of encouraging turf form, most recently third at Hamilton on penultimate start, but latest effort doesn't augur well; others have stronger claims.

5:30.race_name: Download The PricedUp App Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 3.52, 4.22, 4.55 & 5.30 +6yds)

runners.name: Beach Point
runners.owner: John & Peter Seabrook And Tim Fisher
runners.comment: Form dipped with cheekpieces back on latest start; strong each-way player if back to form
runners.spotlight: Won four times in 2024 and runner-up four times in a row, over C&D (good to firm) on final occasion, before a lesser show when cheekpieces were reinstated at Yarmouth three weeks ago; loses them today and looks a strong each-way player if that brings him back to form.

quotes.race: Ron And Esther Leahy Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the application of cheekpieces and the step up to ten furlongs has helped Beach Point. His brother improved for doing exactly the same and I'd been wanting to do it for the last couple of runs. I think he had his right conditions today and Callum gave him a lovely ride. We'll freshen him up now but I'd like to think he'd be a horse on the upgrade - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Milteye
runners.comment: Placed in 1m handicaps this year on both starts back in Britain but stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: 1m winner as 3yo and placed in 1m handicaps this year on both starts back in Britain; needs extra and his several ventures beyond 1m have not been a success.

runners.name: La Fleur Petrus
runners.owner: Chris Wright & The Grand Crus Lovers
runners.comment: Free-going sort; no serious impact this year in her three starts for new yard, 1m2f latest
runners.spotlight: Free-going sort who won over 7f on AW in February 2024 in her time with Charlie Johnston; no serious impact this year in her three starts for new yard, making her first turf appearances on last two occasions and latest was over 1m2f here; fair bit to prove.

runners.name: Dawn Of Liberation
runners.comment: Five-runner Beverley race (1m2f, good) 11 days ago was first win since 2022; back up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Way down the weights and finally made the most of it when strong late on in a five-runner race at Beverley (1m2f, good) 11 days ago, recording his first win since 2022; back up 4lb and needs to take his revival to another level but he's not fully exposed at this trip.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dawn Of Liberation ran so badly at Newmarket last time and nobody could really understand that. He emptied, but was quite free, so a mile might be better for him. He's still a baby and I think Churchill's progeny will just get better as they go on. We thought a lot of him before Newmarket - Paul Roy, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He'd sometimes been running to 102 and other times to 82, so we've tidied his wind up and I think he'll go to a handicap at Newmarket on Guineas day. He wouldn't want it soft. 02-05-23

There's a £20,000 race at Musselburgh on Sunday lined up for this well-bred sort. It's for those rated 41-68 and, as he's 68, it's the perfect opportunity. This time last year he was rated 85, so he has become well handicapped. 09-04-25

runners.name: The Hun

runners.spotlight: Second in four of eight starts for Karl Burke but beaten a long way on all three for new yard; headgear was changed on last two starts but he now goes without any; stays 1m2f and he was 11lb higher this time last year.

runners.name: Eeetee

runners.name: Molly Valentine

runners.name: Universal Story

runners.name: Landing Board

runners.spotlight: Has had only five races; C&D novice winner (good to soft) last July on second outing; she's not improved on that form in her three handicaps (all about 1m4f) and latest was a heavy defeat, but absent 203 days since and it's possible she can return refreshed.

runners.name: Island Of Skye
runners.comment: Won stable debut at Thirsk (1m) last June; backward steps in his three starts since
runners.spotlight: In his fourth season and has won three 1m races, latest on stable debut at Thirsk (good to firm; by a nose off 1lb higher than today) last June when back from a break; backward steps in his three starts since, last month's after 267 days off; this is only his third attempt at 1m2f and he was second over it once on AW in 2023, but other candidates seem more likely.

runners.name: Roman Secret
runners.owner: Dr M Voikhansky & Mrs S Voikhanskaya

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Best turf results have been in the mud; left Richard Fahey for 7,000gns in October

runners.name: Monsieur Patat
runners.comment: Made a winning return from a break at Windsor nine days ago; respected under a penalty.
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return at Windsor (6f, good to firm) nine days ago following a break, coming home well from off the solid pace; he can race freely so the lack of forecast pace is a slight concern but he's respected under a 4lb penalty.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: They went quite fast and that played into our hands. When you're in this sort of form, everything falls right and it has done today - Adrian Wintle, trainer of Monsieur Patat.

runners.name: Thunderous Love
runners.comment: Won her first two starts this term but a poor start blew her chance last time.
runners.spotlight: Overcame slow starts to win her first two starts this season, at Southwell (6f, AW) on the first occasion before following up over this C&D, but she wasn't able to recover from another slow start at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) last time; looks capable off this mark but she will need to break better.

runners.name: Call Glory
runners.comment: No win since his 2yo days; runner-up off 3lb higher in January; below best recently.
runners.spotlight: Without a win since he was a 2yo but has was runner-up at Southwell (6f, AW) off 3lb higher in January; below his best the last twice but the drop back to 6f should suit; returns to turf off a career low mark.

runners.name: Toptime
runners.comment: Six-time winner; respectable efforts over 5f the last twice; can go well from the front.
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner (5f/6f), most recently at Southwell in December off 2lb lower; respectable runs on turf over 5f the last twice and the step back up to this trip should be fine; capable of going well from the front.

runners.name: Instant Bond

runners.comment: Showed ability last year but he was well beaten on seasonal/handicap debut; more needed.

runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.comment: Appreciated the drop to 6f to win at Leicester in April; needs to bounce back from Thirsk.
runners.spotlight: Won on his fourth start for Dylan Cunha when dropped to 6f at Leicester (good) off 3lb lower in April but ran below that level at Thirsk (6f, good to firm) following an awkward start 18 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Sounds Of Spring
runners.comment: All four wins have been on testing ground; headgear removed on first start since October.
runners.spotlight: All four of his wins have been on testing ground, the most recent at Ffos Las (6f, heavy) last August; has the headgear/tongue-tie left off on his first start since October and is best watched on ground that will probably be quicker than ideal.

quotes.race: Play The tote Exacta On Every Race Handicap
quotes.quote: Sounds Of Spring may run on the last day of the season at Naas, he's run well there in the past before. There is a 5f 0-90 and we'll have to see if he gets in. If not this might be his last run - Ken Condon, trainer.

quotes.race: navanracecourse.ie Maiden
quotes.quote: Sounds Of Spring had a good run on this sort of ground at Limerick, but Ken thought the visor woke him up at home the other morning. I don't think it was the strongest race. He winged the gates and was comfortable all the way - Shane Foley, trainer

runners.name: Mccauleys Tavern

runners.name: Padesha

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't run yet. He's a half-brother to a three-year-old filly called Sparkling Beauty, who we like. He's been showing the right signs at home. We gave him a couple of lofty entries but he did something to a hock and got an infection. He's nearly sound again and it's just set us back a little bit. I'm hoping we'll get him out this season. He has an entry in the Futurity at Doncaster. Whether that proves to be flying too high I don't know but we think he's a very nice horse. 21-09-23

runners.name: Eternal Force
runners.comment: Plenty of improvement when 4th in Newmarket novice (1m) and it looks as if 1m2f will suit
runners.spotlight: Beat just one at Newmarket (7f, soft) in October but well bred and found plenty of improvement when fourth of eight to a smart prospect in another Newmarket novice (1m, good) 19 days ago; same yard as Mukhtalif; set for further improvement and it looks as if 1m2f will suit.

runners.spotlight: Second foal; Sea The Stars half-brother to 1m winner Markoon (RPR 101); dam 1m/1m2f Listed winner (111), out of Listed-placed 1m4f winner, is granddaughter of 10.5f/1m4f Group 1 winner Aquarelliste; same stable as Eternal Force; with powerful connections and needs a close look.

runners.spotlight: Late foal; 170,000euros yearling; 12-1, fair form in midfield for novice at Kempton (1m2f, AW; tongue tied) in April, running on but never dangerous; that's not the best form in this field but he looks sure to improve.

runners.name: Harrys Halo
runners.owner: Jones, Keane, Kryswicki & Kf Racing Club

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Frost Racing Club & David Orr

runners.comment: Happiest on slow ground; returns from a layoff without usual accessories; best watched
runners.spotlight: Has won on good but his best form has come on a slow surface; ended 2024 in fine form but he returns from seven months off with neither headgear nor his usual tongue-tie; perhaps one for another day.

runners.name: Emperor Caradoc
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux & Skymarc Farm Inc

prev_owners.owner: Dan Maltby Bloodstock Ltd & B Smart

runners.comment: Travelled strongly when winning at Nottingham (beat Lord Abama) latest; 4lb rise to defy
runners.spotlight: Travelled best and found enough to repel Lord Abama at Nottingham last month (6f, good to firm); a 4lb rise asks a stiffer question of him but versatile groundwise and more appealing than some.

runners.name: Hectic
runners.breeder: Miss Nell Kent & Miss Sophie Bates
runners.comment: Cheekpieces were added at York on Saturday & he ran well for 4th of 20; claims with repeat
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces were added at York on Saturday and he ran well for fourth in a 20-runner Class 4, beaten under 3l; this isn't quite so competitive and he shouldn't be far away with a repeat.

quotes.race: bet365 EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Hectic is very straightforward, he trains himself. We've made a lot of entries for him and when we've gone to declare we haven't. He was there to be shot at in front and there's a lot of improvement to come. Dobby loved him and said the ground didn't feel that quick on him; I'd say the ground's lovely. You might look at something like the Acomb, and he's very nice. He's a heavy-set, strong lad, so we'll have to be careful and I'd say he'd get seven furlongs no problem. That was probably quite a smart race - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We struggled to get him back last year after he failed mentally to handle his second outing at York. He ran a super race in a Newbury handicap over seven furlongs on soft ground on his reappearance, though, and I think he'll be a lot better on a sounder surface and with that run under his belt. I was disappointed he went up 6lb, but I think he'll still be very competitive in good handicaps on his way to the Britannia. 02-05-23

Some of the horses just aren't getting their heads in front and this guy is one. He's taken a couple of runs to get fit this year but he's got them under his belt now. He ran a massive race to finish fourth at York last month under Hollie Doyle and we were pleased with that. Unfortunately at Doncaster on his next start, Kieran O'Neill dropped his reins in the last 100 yards and we were just beaten in a photo-finish by Silver Samurai. He might go to Pontefract on Sunday and he'll be a solid handicapper who'll go to the likes of York and be competitive - he was a good fifth there last weekend. 21-06-24

runners.name: Sacred Falls
runners.comment: Two good Catterick runs this season before having excuses at Carlisle latest; respected
runners.spotlight: Bright start to her campaign, third at Catterick (Animate fourth) before winning at the same track two weeks later; messed around early at Carlisle last time and she can be given a pass for that effort; one to take seriously back down in class.

runners.name: Lord Abama
runners.owner: Mrs K S Pratt, P R Blackett, M Dods
runners.comment: Comes here on the back of two good second places; needs a career-best to defy current mark
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who comes here on the back of second-place finishes at Thirsk and Nottingham (both 6f, good to firm); wellbeing a positive but he will need to raise his game to defy this mark.

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Three wins already this year; latest run easy to excuse and he holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Three wins this year, the last two on turf, and still feasibly weighted; has been a beaten favourite on his last two starts, but wouldn't judge him too harshly on the latest at Catterick where he saw no daylight for much of the straight and finished with running in him; each-way shout.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Cash In
runners.comment: On a stiff mark and the handicapper proving slow to release his grip
runners.spotlight: Hit hard for a win in a weak AW maiden (5f) in November and the handicapper proving slow to cut him slack this season; latest Redcar fourth was a bit better without suggesting he was the answer.

runners.name: Mart
runners.comment: Unpenalised for Saturday's Lingfield win (had optimal track position); obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Had a near miss over 6f at Lingfield two weeks ago and made no mistake back at that track on Saturday night, able to exploit the favoured stands' rail; escapes a penalty for that apprentice-race win; this is tougher but still commands respect.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: The last three times Mart has been here, he's had such a bad draw, so today I said to Dylan [Cunha, trainer]: "I'm drawn out in the car park again, I'm just going to have to make the most of him" and I did well enough to get where I wanted. I thought I was beaten turning in but then he hit his last gear and motored home to win quite nicely - Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Animate
runners.owner: Tom Goodair, Jimmy Kay, John Beamson
runners.comment: On a good mark and his reappearance was promising; excuses latest; headgear back on today
runners.spotlight: Now 4lb lower than for his Catterick success 12 months ago; made a promising return at that track in April before plenty went wrong back there two weeks later; cheekpieces back on today; betting can help.

quotes.race: 5th Regiment Royal Artillery Handicap
quotes.quote: When I first got Animate I thought he was going to be a proper horse. He's been a bit disappointing, but I've taken the extra headgear off and he's loved it today. That's the first time he's won on turf, hopefully he can take off from it. I haven't had him that long, but I've found the key to him and he'll go forward now -  Geoffrey Harker, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Dicko The Legend
runners.owner: Mrs S Hibbert, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Still feasibly treated and he's one of the likelier ones back down to Class 5 company
runners.spotlight: Yet to win off a mark this high but likely to put that right at some point; creditable effort in a Class 4 at Ascot last month (6f good to firm) on his return to turf; capable when things pan out for him.

runners.name: Flag Of Love
runners.comment: Little solid form in her five starts; drops to 6f with a point to prove
runners.spotlight: Standout effort came in a small-field soft-ground fillies' novice at Haydock last summer (for Harry Charlton); well beaten in two runs for new yard this year and now drops to 6f for the first time; risky.

runners.name: Neapolitan
runners.comment: Tumbled down the weights for current stable; wind op in February needs to arrest the slide
runners.spotlight: Rated much higher when trained by the Crisfords; 16lb lower than when making his stable debut last October and he has had wind surgery since last seen in February; others look more persuasive.

7:22.race_name: Energy Oasis Your Net Zero Partner Handicap

runners.name: Without Compromise
runners.comment: 0-9; third on Southwell AW in March; drops back to 1m on turf debut after a wind operation
runners.spotlight: 0-9 but he has shown ability on AW and wasn't beaten far when third of eight at Southwell (1m3f, AW) in March; makes his turf debut following a wind operation but the drop back to 1m isn't sure to suit.

runners.name: Keady Town
runners.comment: Beaten 32l on yard debut last year and he's shown little in two starts over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Had some fair Flat form last year for Richard Hughes but he was beaten 32l in this sphere on yard debut last August and has shown little over hurdles in two starts this year.

runners.name: Carnival Zain
runners.comment: Without a win since 2022; fourth on his reappearance but failed to build on that last time
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since August 2022 but he's on a handy mark and ran well when fourth of 15 at Thirsk (1m, good) on reappearance; failed to build on that back there 18 days ago and but has place claims if bouncing back.

quotes.race: #allintherace Ascot Lady Amateur Riders' Trophy (A Class 3 Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's great. I struggled for a few years to even get a ride in this race. We had Carnival Zain entered last year and the ground was a little bit quicker than it was today and we took him out. I wish we hadn't. He's a better horse this year, he's grown up this season and he's a big strong horse. He loves his racing and he's taken to it very well, which is credit to Micky and the team. Micky has done a great job with him, he's not easy to deal with and is a little bit quirky, he's quite similar in character to his trainer. It's a dream for me, to win a race at Ascot for us is massive - Becky Smith, rider.

runners.name: Code Purple
runners.comment: Last 2 wins at Musselburgh and returned to form back there last time; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Last two wins have been at Musselburgh (7f/1m1f) and he returned to form back there 52 days ago, when second of 13 having had to use some fuel to get into a handy position from a wide draw; off since and as a prominent racer he hasn't been done any favours by his draw again.

runners.name: Jez Bomb
runners.comment: Won at Thirsk in April and posted a solid effort following an awkward start here last time
runners.spotlight: 5-21; won at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) in April off 3lb lower and he's posted two fair efforts since, including over 1m2f here 17 days ago when starting awkwardly; respected back down in trip.

runners.name: Catton Lady
runners.owner: W H & Mrs J A Tinning & Mrs C Wallis
runners.comment: 1-14; well beaten on reappearance but might have needed it and now on career-low mark
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on her debut over 5f at Carlisle in June 2023 but she was in the first three on five occasions last year off higher marks than today's; beaten a long way on reappearance at Beverley (1m, good) but may have needed it and she's dropped to a career-low mark; has possibilities.

runners.name: Alfie Boy
runners.comment: Made all to win twice this season but raced too freely at Beverley; bounce back needed
runners.spotlight: Made all to win at Beverley (8.5f, good) in April and Ayr (1m, good to firm) in May but he raced too enthusiastically when back at Beverley 22 days ago and faded; holds claims if bouncing back; stablemate of Poet's Dawn.

runners.name: Northbound
runners.comment: Won twice on AW this year; 1-22 on turf but he has a place chance on second start for yard
runners.spotlight: Two wins at around 1m on AW this year; 1-22 on turf but he was only beaten a short head at Wetherby (7f, good to firm) in April (his final start for Peter Niven); seventh of 12 in this grade at Beverley (8.5f, good to firm) on stable debut 22 days ago; place chance.

runners.name: Poets Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs J K Powell & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: Veteran who has been in good form; second of 11 at Redcar last time; on a career-low mark
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has been in good form; made the frame twice over 1m2f here in May before runner-up at Redcar (1m, good to firm) eight days ago; back up in grade but he's on a career-low mark and has to be respected.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: It felt like the leader was getting away but Poet's Dawn has a big heart and he dug deep. He's a grand horse to have in the yard, he goes on any ground and very versatile - David Allan, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: Poet's Dawn slipped coming out the stalls at Beverley last time and couldn't get in the race. He loves a bit of cut in the ground and David said he seemed to go better left-handed than right - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In Glorious HD Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: The race that Poet's Dawn ran in at Redcar last time worked out quite well with several winners coming out of it, and this didn't look a particularly good race - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Saisons Dor
runners.comment: Back up 2lb for his Southwell AW win 34 days ago; steps back up to 1m and returns to turf
runners.spotlight: Won over 8.5f in 2019 but all of his victories since have been at around 7f; had a wide trip two runs back but he's gone back up only 2lb for his Southwell AW win last month when he made most of the running; back up in trip and returned to turf.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We were expecting a good run but were worried about the draw and the rain-softened ground. Saisons D'Or has proved his versatility and it opens up more options - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Saisons D'Or battled well to the line. He's a consistent horse and the mile suited him well here. He was a bit gassy as a youngster but settles much better now and that enables him to stay this trip - Jack Garritty, jockey.

runners.name: Ey Up Its Jazz

prev_owners.owner: Jastar Ltd, Murt Khan & Harry Wigan

runners.comment: All three wins have been on soft/heavy ground; trip is an unknown on return from break
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been at 6f-7f on soft/heavy ground, with the most recent coming at Redcar in November off 3lb lower; well beaten in Class 4 company four days later and he's been off since; this trip is an unknown and the ground may not be slow enough for him.

runners.name: Astronomica
runners.comment: Both wins at 1m on soft in 2023; runner-up twice last year; will appreciate any rain
runners.spotlight: Both wins at 1m on soft in 2023; runner-up on two occasions last season and she was fourth of 14 at Newmarket (1m1f, good) in November when last seen; has won fresh before and would appreciate any rain.

runners.name: Overlooked
runners.comment: 0-15 but has shaped encouragingly a few times since joining this yard; steps back up to 1m
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but he has shaped encouragingly on a few occasions since joining this stable last year; never involved from off the pace when sent off favourite on his first start for 110 days at Chelmsford (7f, AW; 11-4); can race freely so will need to settle on the return to 1m.

runners.name: Mr Jetman
runners.comment: Gained his first win in nearly two years over C&D 17 days ago; back up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Placed in his first three starts for this yard before below best at Beverley in April; bounced back to gain his first win in two years over C&D (good) 17 days ago off 5lb lower; has claims up in grade.

runners.name: Shamardal Star

prev_owners.owner: Keatley Racing Owners Group & D Moore

runners.comment: 0-8 (bumper/Flat) for Adrian Keatley; switches back to turf on stable debut
runners.spotlight: 0-8 (bumper/Flat) for Adrian Keatley; posted a respectable effort at Kempton (1m, AW) when last seen in January and now switches back to turf on debut for this yard; watch the betting on return from a break.

8:22.race_name: Ripon Green-Scheme Discounts For Greener Travel Handicap

runners.name: Rock Of England
runners.comment: 0-13 for P Midgley but tumbled down the weights; yard's record in this race is notable
runners.spotlight: 0-13 for current stable but there were some good runs in defeat last year and his slow start to 2025 has seen him drop 9lb in the weights; stable has a fine record in this race and a revival could be imminent.

runners.name: Zaphea
runners.comment: Two heavy defeats in Class 4 so far this year; only of interest if attracting support
runners.spotlight: Won four times in a productive 2024 campaign; unfancied and has run accordingly in two Class 4 handicaps at Musselburgh this spring; down in class but only of interest if attracting support.

runners.name: Dark Kestrel
runners.comment: Slow starts an issue; dangerous mark if his latest wind surgery has the desired effect
runners.spotlight: Slow starts often leave him a hostage to fortune and he hasn't won as often as he probably ought to have; that said, he has a lowly turf rating to exploit and a wind operation since last seen (his third) could have a positive effect.

runners.name: Wrestling Revenue
runners.comment: Two Brighton wins for T Carroll last year; yet to match that in four runs for new trainer
runners.spotlight: Won two small-field sprints at Brighton last summer; slow start for new stable but there was some money about for him prior to his third at Pontefract when last seen eight weeks ago; another 1lb lower this time but may need more help from the assessor; stable also runs Chief Of State.

runners.name: Jojo Rabbit
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xiii & Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Two wins off much higher marks last year; type to pop up soon & he's run well here before
runners.spotlight: Two wins last season off 10lb and 8lb higher marks; yet to find top form this season but this should suit better than Chelmsford last month and he's too well treated to ignore.

quotes.race: Watch Royal Ascot On Sky Sports Racing Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Jojo Rabbit got a nice lead this time rather than at Lingfield where he made the running and got hassled out of it. He's a nice type - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Found things a bit tight on the rail at Wolverhampton on Monday but ran on to be just behind the leaders. 09-04-25

runners.name: Chief Of State
runners.comment: Potential improver now handicapping at a realistic level in new accessories
runners.spotlight: Second Irish run was better than his debut; showed speed before dropping away on his first start for Ben Haslam at Doncaster last month (6f, good to firm); tongue-tie and cheekpieces (worn once before) are deployed today; market useful on handicap debut.

runners.name: Running Cool
runners.comment: Struggled since joining this yard but tumbled down the weights; check betting back at 5f
runners.spotlight: Capable in Ireland but he's beaten the grand total of eight rivals in seven runs for Tim Easterby; dropped 26lb for his troubles and returning to 5f can help; only of interest if backed.

stable_tour.quote: We're very happy with him. He's a strong horse who's joined us from Ireland and has been gelded since - he'll be better for that. He's from the family of Jamarj, who did so well for my father, and he's quick. 23-04-24

runners.name: Herakles
runners.comment: Won this race off 9lb higher last year; yet to shine in 2025 but can't discount a revival
runners.spotlight: Won the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 9lb higher mark but came here in good order then and that isn't the case in 2025; can't rule out for a stable that have won this race in three of the last four years (also runs Rock Of England).

stable_tour.quote: He's been great. He had a wind op and then won at Newcastle in January. He's pretty solid and pretty consistent. His Ripon win last time was a career-best and I'm hoping he'll progress as he gets stronger. I'd be amazed if he lasted all summer as he had a winter campaign, but he'll have a break at some stage and that could well be the making of him. He's a big, tall horse and hopefully he'll grow into something better than he is at the moment. 28-06-24

runners.name: Caesars Pearl
runners.comment: Just one win from 20 starts; not at best on AW earlier in the year; opposable back at 5f
runners.spotlight: 6f turf win two years ago remains her only success from 20 starts; not at her best in two AW runs earlier in the year and the return to turf and 5f isn't enough to tempt.

6:50.race_name: Yorkshire Accountants Ripon Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Carly Minogue
runners.comment: 4yo by Postponed; third foal; dam placed 7f AW (RPR 67); best watched on debut.
runners.spotlight: 4yo by Postponed; third foal; dam placed 7f AW (RPR 67), sister to 5f 2yo winner Fangfoss Girls and 6f winner Neduardo, closely related to 7f-1m4f winner What Usain, out of half-sister to Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner Doric Charm; best watched on debut.

runners.name: Beat The Odds
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on debut at Newcastle; switches to turf and up in trip.
runners.spotlight: Dam 7f-9.5f winner (including 2yo/AW: RPR 76); failed to beat a rival when sent off a big price on debut at Newcastle (1m, AW; 100-1); up in trip and switches to turf; others preferred.

runners.name: Bovey Belle
runners.comment: Shown little in three starts and makes little appeal.
runners.spotlight: Shown little in three starts, latest in first-time blinkers at Yarmouth (11.5f, good to firm), and makes little appeal.

runners.name: Orionis
runners.comment: Form of her Chester runner-up effort has worked out well and she sets the standard.
runners.spotlight: Sixth on debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) last year and has shown improvement in two starts on turf this season, finishing third of eight at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) then second of six behind Derby entry Al Wasl Storm at Chester (12.5f, good; third and fourth have won since); sets the standard on form.

runners.name: Praying For Time
runners.owner: Tactful Finance, S Roden & T Solway
runners.comment: Beaten 23l at Wolverhampton last time and she's best watch on yard/turf debut.
runners.spotlight: Ex-Gosden filly; fifth of seven on her debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) but went backwards from that effort when beaten 23l over 1m4f at Wolverhampton last time; best watched on stable/turf debut.

runners.name: Ritaan
runners.comment: Dam 6f-1m winner; last of three runners on debut at Doncaster; needs to improve.
runners.spotlight: 40,000euros foal and 300,000gns yearling; dam prolific Greek 6f-1m winner; made the running on debut at Doncaster (1m2f, good) but dropped away after being headed, finishing last of three runners; may improve with the outing under her belt.

runners.name: Sweet Princess
runners.comment: Third foal; dam 7f-1m2f winner (including Canadian Grade 1; 110); interesting on debut.
runners.spotlight: By Sea The Stars; third foal; half-sister to winners Arabic Legend (Listed-placed 7f 2yo; RPR 101) and Youngest (7f 2yo; 86); dam 7f-1m2f winner (including Canadian Grade 1; 110), sister to 6f 2yo Group 1/1m Listed winner Lumiere, out of 7f 2yo winner; useful pedigree and she's interesting on debut.

6:15.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Believeinmenow
runners.comment: Went backwards from his debut effort at Doncaster last time; needs to bounce back.
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when second of ten at Thirsk (5f, good) but proved disappointing at Doncaster (5f, good to firm; raced freely) 18 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Enjoy The Night
runners.comment: 125,000gns yearling; half-brother to Gr 3 winning sprinter White Lavender; watch market.
runners.spotlight: 125,000gns yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to four winners including White Lavender (5f/5.7f including Group 3; RPR 111) and Blinky (5f including 2yo/AW; RPR 87); dam unraced half-sister to HK 1m Group 1 winner Xtension; watch the market on debut.

runners.name: Fortification
runners.comment: £350,000 breeze-up purchase; third of six when a short price on debut; can improve.
runners.spotlight: £52,000 yearling and £350,000 breeze-up purchase; dam 5f 2yo Listed winner (RPR 103); third of six when sent off a short price on debut at Bath (5f, firm; 4-9; wandered around) 12 days ago; should improve for that outing.

runners.name: Great Profit
runners.breeder: Oghill House Stud & Joseph M Burke
runners.comment: £360,000 breeze-up purchase; half-brother to two winners; yard won this in 2022 and 2024.
runners.spotlight: 16,000euros yearling and £360,000 breeze-up purchase; eighth foal; Profitable colt who is a half-brother to winners World Title (7.4f/1m 2yo, RPR 89) and Big Dream (7f/1m AW; RPR 79); dam Italian 1m winner, half-sister to 6f-7.5f Group 1 winner Gordon Lord Byron; lots to like on paper for a yard that won this with subsequent Abbaye winner Platinum Queen in 2022 and again last year.

runners.name: Major Neigh Sayer
runners.comment: $350,000 yearling; dam half-sister to Group 1 winner Dabirsim; watch the betting on debut.
runners.spotlight: $350,000 yearling; by No Nay Never; third foal; dam placed 1m2f-1m4f (RPR 79), half-sister to 6f/7f 2yo Group 1 winner Dabirsim, out of a half-sister to Italian 1m1f Group 3 winner Fathayer, is a granddaughter of Italian Oaks winner Bright Generation; the dams' side of the pedigree suggests he may want a bit further but watch the betting on debut.

runners.name: Monty Magoo
runners.comment: Down the field in the Brocklesby on debut 67 days ago and needs to improve.
runners.spotlight: Down the field in the Brocklesby at Doncaster (5f, good to soft; 11-1) 67 days ago; refused to enter the stalls at Pontefract in April; needs to improve.

runners.name: Star Material
runners.comment: Built on his debut effort when runner-up at Pontefract 35 days ago; solid claims.
runners.spotlight: Ran below market expectations when beaten 15l on debut at Musselburgh (5f, good; 7-2) but he was caught out on the wing that day and improved when runner-up to Argentine Tango, who has since won the Hilary Needler, at Pontefract (5f, good) 35 days ago; solid claims.

runners.name: Zoiros
runners.comment: 44,000euros yearling; half-brother to three winners (one useful); watch market.
runners.spotlight: 44,000euros yearling; Sioux Nation colt; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Udododontu (7f/1m; RPR 107), Enzemble (1m-1m2f including AW/HK; 88) and What's She At (7f 2yo; 66); dam unplaced 6f-7.4f (RPR 33), half-sister to 6f/7f 2yo winner Witch Of Fife; betting may be informative on debut.

runners.name: Timeless Spirit
runners.comment: Yet to build on her promising debut effort; down in class but others look safer
runners.spotlight: Ran well for second when a 50-1 shot on her debut at Southwell last October (7f); no progress since, including on her handicap/turf debut five weeks ago (although met trouble in a race that's working out), and others look safer despite the drop in class.

runners.name: Beta Reader
runners.comment: 7f AW win in March; had excuses at Kempton last time and remains capable of better
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap/seasonal debut at Wolverhampton (7f) in March; no progress since but he wasn't seen to best effect at Kempton a fortnight ago and it's too soon to rule out further progress.

runners.name: William Marshal
runners.comment: Modest form in three runs over shorter but this looks more suitable now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well beaten in his three runs in novice/maiden company this spring; bred to do better, however, and stepping up to a mile can help now handicapping at a realistic level.

runners.name: Epicurian Lad
runners.comment: Not progressed this year but down in the weights and the fitting of a visor could help
runners.spotlight: Hasn't progressed as might have been expected this season, but he's edging down the weights and the addition of a visor could give him a lift; one to consider.

runners.name: Flamborough Head
runners.comment: 1m win at Redcar in April; form dipped over 7f latest but the type to bounce back quickly
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win a 1m handicap at Redcar (good ground) in April; solid efforts on his next two starts but his form dipped back at 7f last time; effective over C&D and can bounce back returned to a mile.

runners.name: Sovereign Class
runners.comment: No improvement for the move into handicaps as yet; others look safer
runners.spotlight: No improvement for a switch to handicaps as yet and she looked a tricky ride at Doncaster last month; returning to 1m may help but other looks safer.

runners.name: King At The Races
runners.comment: Down the field in three AW novices last winter; likely improver now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three novice runs on Tapeta in the winter (6f twice and 8.6f); surprising if he doesn't prove more competitive now handicapping at a modest level; betting to guide.

runners.name: Precious Spartan
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Skipped clear against the far rail over C&D on last week's stable debut; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in 11 starts for Nigel Tinkler but did show promise; skipped clear against the far rail on his stable debut over C&D last week and he looks well in under a 6lb penalty, for all today's opposition is more demanding.

runners.name: Caledonian Dream
runners.comment: 0-10 and although recent Redcar return was satisfactory, he'll need more to take this
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; ran okay over 7f at Redcar last month and should be sharper with that behind him; others look stronger all the same.

6:00.race_name: Cancer Research UK Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Hostile Hotelier
runners.comment: Has consistent RPRs over hurdles and fences this year; should give his running
runners.spotlight: Has consistent RPRs over hurdles and fences this year; 3-15 in this sphere and gained most recent success at Catterick, albeit in weak race, in March (3m1f, good); should give his running.

runners.name: Saint Bibiana
runners.owner: The Posh Pundit Racing Club Limited
runners.comment: Won comfortably at Huntingdon last week; cracking chance off same mark (avoids penalty)
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick early last season; comfortably regained the winning thread in conditional jockeys' event at Huntingdon (3m1f, good) last week; cracking chance off same mark (escapes a penalty).

runners.name: Jullou De Grissay
runners.owner: The Galloping Dentist At 45 The Green
runners.comment: Gained two point wins under James King this winter; interesting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Not solid on hurdles form; however, gained two point wins under James King this winter (beaten favourite last time) and therefore looks quite interesting on handicap debut back under rules.

runners.name: Fine By Me
runners.comment: Form figures of 122 over hurdles when fresh; returns from layoff with solid claims
runners.spotlight: Has registered both wins in summer and returns from eight-month absence with solid claims, having produced form figures of 122 over hurdles when fresh; market support would heighten interest.

runners.name: Royal Rhythm
runners.comment: Faller here last month when the outsider of three; no win since 2023
runners.spotlight: Fell four out in similar event here (3m1f) last month when the outsider of three; no win since 2023 and has become inconsistent but remains very well handicapped on best form.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Royal Rhythm got a fantastic ride from James because in my mind the others went way too quick and they were racing too early. He kept taking him back and he probably won too well, he was the only one that finished - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

8:10.race_name: Tetra Real Estate Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Therapist
runners.comment: Arrives on a hat-trick and her latest win has been franked; strong claims
runners.spotlight: In front when left clear at the final flight at Stratford (2m, good) in April, and followed up there (2m, good); had just two rivals to beat last time but the runner-up won immediately before and after; strong claims.

stable_tour.quote: She's been on the go this summer and has done very well. She won twice over hurdles in May and was also a neck second at Newton Abbot last month, while in between she ran an excellent race on the Flat at Goodwood, looking the likely winner two furlongs out but not quite staying the mile and a half. She can continue under both codes until the winter. 22-10-24

runners.name: Fromheretoeternity
runners.breeder: Mrs A L Merry & Mr Brett Merry
runners.comment: Returned from break with fair third of six at Bangor and could build on that run
runners.spotlight: Three wins towards the end of last year after joining this yard (2m, soft-good) and returned from break with fair third of six at Bangor (2m, good) last month; could build on that last run and is a possible player.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fromheretoeternity felt a lot better on that ground compared to Worcester. When she hit the front she was lugging a bit left but it was very impressive from the last. When I gave her a squeeze she just took off. Fair play to Jennie [Candlish, trainer] and Alan [O'Keeffe, assistant], the horses are flying - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports

stable_tour.quote: She won two hurdle races over 2m in October and early November but then didn't stay at Newcastle when stepped up to 2m4½f. She was one of the few who had been purchased or moved across from the Declan Queally yard. We dropped her back to 2m at Plumpton on ­Monday and she was a close second, ­beaten three-quarters of a length. She did it really well at Hexham for her latest win and the handicapper took a proper swipe at her, but hopefully she can justify her mark. While we can run her in novices, she'll run in handicap company as her jumping is so effective. 05-12-24

runners.name: Princess T

prev_owners.owner: Harte Investments Ltd And Dajam Ltd
Harte Investments Ltd And Dajam Ltd

runners.comment: Won at Wincanton last October but was no match for Therapist at Stratford last time
runners.spotlight: Won at Wincanton (1m7f, good) last October and is now just 1lb higher; however, this 10yo hasn't been at the top of her game on either outing this spring and was no match for Therapist at Stratford last time.

runners.name: Blazeon Five
runners.comment: Has potential off her opening jumps mark judged on the pick of her Flat ability
runners.spotlight: Fair second at Chepstow in January on second hurdle start; not at her best on the Flat in April on her sole run since but she has potential off her opening jumps mark judged on the pick of her Flat ability; interesting.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Brown Jack Handicap
quotes.quote: Blazeon Five had a little bronc. I thought she was quite tired pulling up, but perhaps she could have gone around again. She had a little buck and dropped the shoulder on me, it's something you expect on a Monday morning but not here. It was a weird race pace-wise, essentially we had a target to run at entering the straight and he dropped away. Temporize took me to a point where I felt like I was going okay, but when he dropped away I was left in front with a bit to run and I had to commit. I think she was just waiting for him - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

runners.name: Soleil Darizona
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Du Fosse Blanc
runners.comment: Beaten 9l when second of three on C&D handicap debut but not written off for top trainer
runners.spotlight: French Flat winner who landed a maiden hurdle at Haydock (1m7f, good) in April; could do with settling better and she was beaten 9l when second of three on handicap debut over C&D (good) last month, but bumped into a progressive winner and is not written off for her top trainer.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Soleil d'Arizona is not great to watch and Harry confirmed it wasn't great to ride her either. She's got a few little issues that we've had to iron out but if you watch her after the last she really poked her nose out and really wanted to do it. If we can help her through the spring time and into the summer, the easier weather will be easier for her and hopefully she can win a couple more - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A tidy sort for mares' novice hurdles. She whizzed round Exeter first time out but just got caught on the line, so I think a tighter track would suit her better, but she loves her jumping and shows plenty of pace. 12-11-24

8:40.race_name: Virtus Property Services Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Okavango Delta
runners.comment: Back on the scoresheet at Worcester three weeks ago and a 4lb rise may not stop him today
runners.spotlight: Did well for new yard last season with two wins at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft/soft) and was back on the scoresheet at Worcester (2m4f, good) three weeks ago; did it well last time and a 4lb rise may not stop him.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Novices' Handicap Chase
