quotes.quote: The race went to plan. We went a nice, even gallop but I was really concerned about the ground with Okavango Delta. Musselburgh, luckily, when it gets soft it doesn't get too deep, so he's handled it fine. He's in good form and he's got his second round here now. You don't want to hit the front too soon with him, but he jumps so well you often land in front early enough, so you've got to hope he takes you through the race. In fairness, when I committed today, with the cheekpieces on he's honest enough - Craig Nichol, jockey.

runners.name: Theonlywayiswessex
runners.comment: Underwhelming in February but on soft ground; posted an easy win before that
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Plumpton in February and off since; however, perhaps the soft ground didn't suit and before that he posted an easy win at Plumpton (2m3f, good to soft); could rediscover those progressive ways today.

quotes.race: Injured Jockeys Fund 60th Anniversary Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Theonlywayiswessex was one who had the potential to improve for a fence and I think he's no worse over them compared to a hurdle, he's probably slightly better even. He won it well. He ran good the last day there and he's come on for that run a bit. He's a fun horse for the owners and hopefully, in similar conditions, he can nick another one if the handicapper is kind to us - Tom Cannon, jockey.

runners.name: Isocrate
runners.comment: Took step back in right direction last month; could have more to offer now back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Yet to win but took step back in the right direction when third, beaten about 15l, at Ffos Las (2m, good) four weeks ago on his third chase start; this former 3m pointer might have more to offer now back up in trip.

runners.name: Fancy Stuff
runners.comment: Clear with improved winner at Stratford and respected now she's back on song
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row last May/June (2m3f/2m4f, good) and returned to form when second at Stratford (2m3f, good) last month; came clear with an improved winner and she's respected now she's back on song.

runners.name: Redbridge Rambler
runners.breeder: Mrs A L Merry & Mr Brett Merry
runners.comment: Won at Chepstow in March; disappointing favourite since but ten fences were omitted
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over fences at the fourth attempt at Chepstow (2m7f, good) in March; disappointing favourite at Sedgefield since but ten fences were omitted; not written off.

quotes.race: Glidevale Protect Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: To carry that weight was a really good performance. It was almost like a summer's day today and Redbridge Rambler loves having the sun on his back and good ground. He comes alive at this time of the season. James [Best] gave him a lovely ride ? he never got tempted in going for glory too early and timed it to perfection - Martin Keighley, trainer.

runners.name: Harrys Hope
runners.comment: Hat-trick over fences last October; fair 2nd over hurdles last month; could build on that
runners.spotlight: Won last October on first three chase starts (2m3f-2m6f, good/good to soft) and went close at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) next time; flopped at Hereford in December but returned from break with fair second off lower hurdle mark here last month, and could build on that now back over fences.

runners.name: Shadows In The Sky

prev_owners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood

runners.comment: In top form on first two runs for stable and could still have more to offer for the yard
runners.spotlight: Became the latest success story for the stable with win on yard debut on May 17 (2m5f, good), and again ran well when second at Huntingdon (2m4f, good) three days later; he should be fine now back up in trip and may well have more to offer for this yard; key player.

runners.name: Wee Willie Nail
runners.comment: It's a long time since he's shown anything and others have far less to prove.
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle for Gordon Elliott in September 2022 but lightly raced and very slim pickings since; struggled in two British points last May and this is his first run since; others have far less to prove.

quotes.race: Joe Bollard Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wee Willie Nail had plenty of experience. He's probably one who could win in the north of England. He is what he is and he'll be okay. He'll jump a fence in time too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Mrs Tabitha
runners.comment: Fair efforts at Bangor on her two chase starts and she might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner who was a 10l second on chase debut at Bangor (3m, good) in April and produced another fair run when third behind two improving rivals there (3m, good) last time; might not be far away.

stable_tour.quote: She was only just ready to run before her debut, so it was a big surprise when she won really nicely. She's a half-sister to Presenting Percy, so she's bred to do the job and she jumps really well. We'll go novice hurdling and she might be one for those mares' finals in the spring. 01-11-23

runners.name: Noble Cave
runners.comment: Very lightly raced 6yo; check the betting but he's achieved very little thus far
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 6yo who is one to keep an eye on in the betting on his first run since last October, but he's achieved very little thus far; pulled up at 33-1 on his handicap and chase debut when last seen.

runners.name: Deadly Missile
runners.comment: Pulled up at Southwell last month when back from a long absence; 7lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three times in 2023 but pulled up at Southwell last month when back from a long absence and is now 0-14 under rules; 7lb out of the handicap today and it may be best to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Ice In The Veins
runners.comment: Major promise in bumpers; won on the bridle at Worcester last time; useful prospect
runners.spotlight: Skelton runner who has shown major promise in good-ground bumpers, finishing nicely for close second here then going one better at Worcester where he had much more in hand than the 1l margin suggests (won on the bridle); useful prospect.

runners.name: Jefe Triunfo
runners.comment: Has struggled since returning from long absence; something to prove
runners.spotlight: Gained his debut win in weak bumper then had a long layoff; has struggled since returning to action, most recently in Warwick maiden hurdle (2m3f); something to prove.

quotes.race: Every Horse Turned Out Daily richardnewlandracing.com Open NH Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Chris (Gordon) said he quite liked Jefe Triunfo beforehand. I think he's probably too nice to keep going right the way through the summer - Harry Cobden, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Lewis Barnes
runners.comment: Hurdles debutant who has a stamina doubt, having gained Flat win over 6f
runners.spotlight: Related to a couple of hurdles winners but still brings a stamina doubt to debut in this sphere, having gained sole Flat win over 6f; left Stuart Williams since last run; fitted with hood.

runners.name: Maitre De Perles
runners.comment: Absent since final-flight fall on stable/hurdle debut nearly two years ago
runners.spotlight: Absent since final-flight fall (had no chance at the time) on stable/hurdle debut nearly two years ago; 0-4 on Flat previously; best watched unless the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Megascope
runners.comment: Weak claims on form
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced 8yo who has weak claims on form; second start back from lengthy absence.

runners.name: Moves Like Mason
runners.comment: Good second in final attempt in Irish points; no threat in both rules runs
runners.spotlight: Good second in final attempt in Irish points; however, has failed to threaten in two hurdles events for new yard and may be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.name: Belcamo
runners.comment: Brings the best hurdles form and seems likely to benefit from reapplied hood
runners.spotlight: Brings the best hurdles form, namely second-place finish behind fairly useful rival on debut in this sphere; regressed in two subsequent starts but now has the benefit of a hood for first time under this code; recorded his Flat success in this headgear.

runners.name: One Cool Dreamer
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs L Peacock
runners.comment: Fair handicapper on Flat; represents esteemed dual-purpose trainer; likely player
runners.spotlight: Fair handicapper on Flat, winning twice over 1m2f last summer and running creditably amid traffic issues over 1m4f most recently; represents an esteemed dual-purpose trainer and looks one of the main contenders in this field on hurdles debut.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Halstead Handicap
quotes.quote: I feel One Cool Dreamer will get a mile and a half. He enjoyed the good even pace and I thought he pulled out a bit more when the second, ridden by my father, came to me - David Egan, jockey.

7:10.race_name: Rainier Developments & Strategic Land Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Fourtowns
runners.comment: Made it 0-13 when last seen, but good second two runs ago; worth second look on yard debut
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who was well beaten in December on his final run for Ben Pauling; sold for £9,500 in February; however, he was a good second at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) in November and is worth a second look on stable debut.

runners.name: Byzantium
runners.comment: Inconsistent but running well until falling at final flight at Plumpton two starts ago
runners.spotlight: French Flat winner whose hurdle form has been mixed and he failed to shine at Newton Abbot three weeks ago; however, prior to that he was running well until falling at the final flight at Plumpton, and is not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: I was glad we got him back at the Chris Giles dispersal sale as he's a novice hurdle winner waiting to happen, judged on his one run for us at Taunton in March. He's had a wind op and should be ready from the middle of this month. 04-11-24

runners.name: Definite Dream
runners.comment: Lacks a recent run but some good efforts in second half of last year; could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Maiden who is returning from a five-month break but this former pointer ran some good races when switched to rules in the second half of last year and could be thereabouts if at the top of her game.

runners.name: Realistic Optimism
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on handicap debut but returns having had wind op and with yard in fine form
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner, unable to reproduce that promise over hurdles and soundly beaten on handicap debut at Fakenham in January, but he returns from a break having had wind surgery and with his trainer in fine form; no surprise to see a bigger performance today.

runners.name: Red Panda
runners.comment: Ran well for a fair way at Fakenham following a break and could build on that effort
runners.spotlight: Her dam is Snow Leopardess, who won the Becher Chase for these connections; this mare has been a long way from hitting those heights but ran well for a fair way at Fakenham (2m4f, good) four weeks ago when back from a break, and she could build on that effort; first-time cheekpieces replace a hood.

runners.name: Stiletto

prev_owners.owner: G Strawbridge, J Wigan & T Hirosaki

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but Sean Bowen booked for stable debut and one to watch in the betting
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who was tailed off on the Flat in December when last seen; however, he's on a competitive mark and Sean Bowen is booked for his stable debut; one to watch in the betting.

runners.name: Hardy Buck

prev_owners.owner: Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate/W G Hanly
Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate

runners.comment: Well handicapped on his good December second but unable to reproduce that form since
runners.spotlight: He's dropped to a mark 9lb lower than when a good second at Fakenham (2m7f, good to soft) in December but he's failed to reproduce that form on his four runs since and remains a maiden; has to raise his game.

runners.name: Ballymena Boy
runners.comment: Yet to threaten under rules but this point bumper runner-up has a lowly opening mark
runners.spotlight: Yet to threaten under rules but he finished second in a point-to-point bumper and goes handicapping off a lowly mark; this half-brother to a 2m4f hurdle winner could be suited by the step up in trip and is an interesting candidate, especially if attracting market support.

runners.name: Rockbeare
runners.comment: This handicap debut provides a first realistic opportunity but improvement is needed
runners.spotlight: Has got better with each of his four runs, finishing a 22l fifth in a Newton Abbot novice (2m1f, good) four weeks ago, and this handicap debut provides a first realistic opportunity; however, improvement is still needed.

runners.name: Storm Runner
runners.comment: Very little to show from seven career starts so far; eased in grade
runners.spotlight: Very little to show from seven career starts so far; today's drop in grade offers some respite but he still needs to produce a much more convincing performance to feature.

runners.name: Go Go Go
runners.comment: Broke his maiden tag on seasonal return; has remained competitive off higher marks since
runners.spotlight: Broke his maiden tag with a strong 1m win at Sha Tin on seasonal return; has remained competitive off higher marks since and looks set to be in the mix again.

runners.name: Flying Silver
runners.comment: 1m1f winner last season but yet to replicate that form in nine runs this term
runners.spotlight: 1m1f winner last season but yet to replicate that form in nine runs this term; subsequently dropped to a workable mark and can't be ruled out entirely.

runners.name: The Way We Win
runners.comment: Showed signs of life when a creditable sixth last month; longer trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in first nine local starts but showed signs of life when a creditable sixth over 1m1f last month; longer trip could suit but still has something to prove.

runners.name: U S S Constitution
runners.comment: Yet to make his mark locally and ran poorly two weeks ago; needs a major turnaround
runners.spotlight: Yet to make his mark locally and ran poorly two weeks ago; needs a major turnaround to feature.

quotes.race: Ascot Iron Stand Membership British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We might look to throw  U S S CONSTITUTION in at the deep end next time. He's a lovely horse and I think he's the sort to be better when he's in a better class of race too - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Super Hong Kong
runners.comment: On a long losing run but has threatened this season; can bounce back from a lesser effort
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but has threatened this season, notably when second over C&D in March; capable if bouncing back from a lesser effort last time out.

runners.name: Colourful Baron
runners.comment: Scored on the dirt over 1m1f in October but hasn't really fired off his new mark since
runners.spotlight: Scored on the dirt over 1m1f in October but hasn't really fired off his new mark since; needs to find something extra to get involved.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting Irish Champions Weekend (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Cornman is a lovely horse. He was always going to improve for a run and Colin says he will improve again. He was always going to be a three-year-old. He is one to look forward to - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer

runners.name: Super Treasure
runners.owner: Martin Yung Ping Fai & Kwok Yi Chit
runners.comment: Minor signs of progress in recent runs but still below required level after nine starts
runners.spotlight: Minor signs of progress in recent runs but still below the required level after nine career starts; steps up in trip and needs a big leap forward.

runners.name: Mr Aladdin
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden, but recent efforts suggest a breakthrough is imminent; contender
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden, but recent efforts suggest a breakthrough is imminent; knocking firmly on the door and is a serious contender.

runners.name: Golden Fairy
runners.owner: Rex Wong Siu Han, Ivan Wong Siu Kei & Ann Wong Pui Gee
runners.comment: Ran well with a bold bid from the front in April; big player if allowed to dictate
runners.spotlight: Unlucky loser over C&D in December when headed late; ran well again with a bold bid from the front at Sha Tin in April; big player if allowed to dictate.

runners.name: Leather Master
runners.breeder: Mrs C N Taylor & Taylor Family Trust
runners.comment: Got off the mark over 1m1f here two starts back; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over 1m1f here two starts back and backed it up with a solid run off his revised mark last time; should go well again.

runners.name: Joyful Champion
runners.owner: Raymond Chow Wai Kam & Lau Wing Sang
runners.comment: Low strike-rate but was unlucky not to win at Sha Tin in April; dangerous to dismiss
runners.spotlight: Low strike-rate but was unlucky not to win at Sha Tin in April; lesser efforts since but dangerous to fully dismiss on recent evidence.

runners.name: Smart Zipang
runners.comment: Offered little in novice company last season and hasn't made much impact in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Offered little in novice company last season and hasn't made much impact in handicaps this term; readily opposed.

runners.name: Lean Hero
runners.comment: Bit hit-and-miss in six runs this season; down in grade so may have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Bit hit-and-miss in six runs this season, and was beaten out of sight at Sha Tin two weeks ago; however, drops into Class 4 for the first time and could have more to offer at this level.

runners.name: Sundays Serenade
runners.comment: Consecutive wins over the extended mile earlier in the campaign; step forward now needed
runners.spotlight: Scored back-to-back wins over the extended mile earlier in the campaign; held off his new mark last time out, so another step forward is needed.

runners.name: Cant Go Wong
runners.breeder: J S Alexander, W Bevins Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, M Tsang Et Al

runners.comment: C&D winner in December and has gone close a few times since; disappointing here latest
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in December and has gone close a few times since; disappointing here last month but capable of bouncing back if rediscovering best form.

runners.name: Comet Splendido

prev_owners.owner: York Forty Four Ltd And Grant Tuer

runners.comment: Finished last season in good form but hasn't fired in nine runs this term
runners.spotlight: Finished last season in good form but hasn't fired in nine runs this term; now 5lb below his last winning mark.

runners.name: Simple Hedge
runners.comment: Struggling for form and hasn't been competitive in six starts since the turn of the year
runners.spotlight: Struggling for form and hasn't been competitive in six starts since the turn of the year; hard to support despite being well treated on past form.

runners.name: Mission Strike
runners.comment: After a low-key debut he has been heavily involved in four subsequent outings; chance
runners.spotlight: After a low-key debut he has been heavily involved in four subsequent outings; looks more than capable of breaking through off his current mark; chance.

runners.name: Floof
runners.comment: Won first-up on the dirt in September but has found things tougher since; more needed
runners.spotlight: Won first-up on the dirt in September but has found things tougher since; needs to show more spark to be involved here.

runners.name: Sandman
runners.comment: Well beaten in both starts so far and is likely to need more time; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in both starts so far and is likely to need more time; best watched for now.

runners.name: Firefoot
runners.comment: Off the mark in January with a battling win over the extended mile; held form well since
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in January with a battling win over the extended mile; held form well since and should remain competitive.

runners.name: Gor Mo Tuen
runners.comment: Disappointing in ten local starts and hasn't shown enough to suggest he can feature
runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing in ten local starts and hasn't shown enough to suggest he can feature; easy to pass over.

runners.name: S J Tourbillon
runners.owner: Ma Ren De & Dr Ma Yuen Yuen

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Former Class 3 winner who is a long way below that mark, but has offered little recently
runners.spotlight: Former Class 3 winner who is now a long way below that mark, but has offered little recently; needs a revival.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: he's been nurtured along so, I suppose, Group/Classic material is where they really want to end up. I'd be happy enough to say a mile is comfortable enough for him, maybe even back a furlong starting next year - Seamie Heffernan, jockey

runners.name: Kasa Papa

prev_owners.owner: Dynamic Syndications Racing, J R Carter Et Al

runners.comment: Got off the mark locally over C&D in January, followed by a near miss in March; claims
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark locally over C&D in January, followed by a near miss in March; strong claims if reproducing that form.

runners.name: Figopumpkin
runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.comment: Three underwhelming starts so far; hard to recommend if making the line-up
runners.spotlight: Three underwhelming starts so far; hard to recommend if making the line-up.

runners.name: Star Brose
runners.owner: Peter Young Wai Po & David Young Yuk Chuen
runners.comment: Fair sixth on debut and again posted another respectable effort at Sha Tin last month
runners.spotlight: Fair sixth on debut and again posted another respectable effort at Sha Tin last month; minor place contender.

12:40.race_name: Wong Nai Chung Gap Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)

runners.name: Fortune Whiskey
runners.owner: Alan Tsang Ping Sing, Fiona Tsang Wai Sze Et Al
runners.comment: Dual C&D scorer; C&D third on his last two starts; shortlisted despite wide draw.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season and has finished third over C&D in each of his last two starts; should go well again here though his wide draw does temper enthusiasm.

runners.name: King Eccellente
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Patrick Fung Pak Tung & Ophelia Fung Wing Sei

prev_owners.owner: Mr & Mrs Patrick Fung Pak Tung & Ophelia Fung Wing Sei

runners.comment: Inconsistent; likes this C&D and is down to his highest winning mark; lacks 2025 form.
runners.spotlight: Three times a C&D hero who is back down to the handicap rating of his most recent victory (5f) on Boxing Day; five modest efforts since then suggest he is no longer in peak health.

runners.name: Beauty Thunder
runners.comment: 0-9 in Hong Kong; C&D second in April then denied clear run latest; Purton now recruited.
runners.spotlight: 7.5f winner in Ireland; posted best Hong Kong effort on eighth try when beaten by a neck over this C&D; denied clear passage last time so merits consideration with Zac Purton aboard for the first time.

runners.name: Mega Bonus
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Tser Yiu Cho, J Tser Ka Ho & Johnson Tser Ka Yu
runners.comment: Front-runner; won five C&D races before current win drought; good apprentice booked.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner with five C&D successes to his name, though none in the last 13 months; down to a fair mark (has won off 7lb higher) and booking of top apprentice is a positive.

runners.name: Incanto Star
runners.comment: Debutant who has not showed much in three trial race outings; bred to stay a bit further.
runners.spotlight: Full-brother to a 7f winner who fetched NZ$120,000 as a 2yo; hard to see him making much impact here having posted three moderate efforts in trial races.

runners.name: Szeryng
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay & Mrs J E Lindsay
runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.comment: No great encouragement during 5f debut two weeks ago; big outsider again here.
runners.spotlight: Never a factor before finishing 5.25l eighth of 12 here (5f) as a 51-1 chance on debut a fortnight ago; may require a drop in the ratings before he can be competitive.

runners.name: Wiseman
runners.comment: Better effort when only beaten by 2.5l over C&D last time; drawn wide today, though
runners.spotlight: Stepped up from modest debut to finish 2.5l sixth of 12 as a 66-1 chance over C&D three weeks ago; should continue to improve but has wide draw to overcome.

runners.name: Jolly Companion
runners.comment: Prominent racer with wide draw who seems to be appreciably better on dirt.
runners.spotlight: Double-figure odds for both local wins (each over 6f on dirt); only 2lb above latest successful mark but has yet to make the top three in 13 attempts on turf; wide draw no help.

runners.name: Golden Friendship
runners.owner: Janet Wong Hoi Shan, John Yuen Se Kit Et Al
runners.comment: 4lb lower than for three decent C&D runs; latest dirt run best forgiven (lame afterwards).
runners.spotlight: Showed promise over this C&D in each of his first three starts, then found to be lame after modest dirt effort; could easily improve enough to go close provided he is fully fit.

runners.name: Good Prospect
runners.comment: Disappointing last time; repetition of three earlier C&D seconds would give him a shout.
runners.spotlight: Winless start to his career has now lasted ten outings; runner-up three times over C&D before lesser run (slight traffic problems) last time; should not be far away.

runners.name: Vulcanus
runners.comment: New turf career best when beaten by 0.75l last time; chance again off 1lb higher.
runners.spotlight: Best form (and only win) from 23 starts had been on dirt prior to his 0.75l second over this C&D three weeks ago; well drawn so should go well again off 1lb higher mark.

runners.name: Fortune Racer
runners.breeder: Mrs A J Horne & B R Horne
runners.comment: Showed first sign of ability over 5f last time; considerable further progress needed.
runners.spotlight: First run for this trainer when improved front-running 4.25l eighth of 14 (5f, Sha Tin) last time but needs to make considerable further progress to be involved in the finish here.

runners.name: Prime Mortar
runners.comment: Last three runs have been below par but has plenty of decent previous C&D form; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Twice a narrow runner-up over this C&D early this year but less convincing in three subsequent runs; 1lb higher than for any of his three C&D successes.

runners.name: Island Breezes
runners.comment: Would have a squeak on his best form; has never before run away from Sha Tin; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and still a maiden after nine tries; trying Happy Valley for the first time on the back of two poor 5f efforts at Sha Tin.

runners.name: Midori Fuji
runners.comment: Has Purton booked after two short head C&D defeats (raised 2lb for each); major player.
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden after eight runs having endured short-head C&D reverses in each of his last two starts; has Purton up for the first time today so likely to be strong in the betting.

runners.name: Setanta
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See

prev_owners.owner: Aquis Farm, C J Barham Et Al

runners.comment: Two of his four wins have been over C&D; needs to bounce back after two lesser efforts.
runners.spotlight: Twice a C&D scorer but its now over 11 months since his last success; has posted three C&D thirds off higher marks this season but his last two starts have been underwhelming.

runners.name: Across Da Universe
runners.comment: Upped from 7f; yet to repeat his decent Irish form in eight local appearances.
runners.spotlight: Useful in Ireland but has yet to start at shorter than 12-1 in eight local outings or finish in the top four; last five races have all been over 7f.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Buyin Buyin was strong at the finish and looked like he might get another furlong. He was workmanlike rather than spectacular but I'll take it. Hopefully we might run him in the Anglesey Stakes in a couple of weeks. I think he deserves to go and whether he is good enough we're not sure - Willie Browne, trainer.

runners.name: Flying Wrote
runners.owner: Simon Tsang Heung Tung & Shirley Tsang Huang Yang
runners.comment: 6f winner who showed he stayed this trip with a 1.75l fourth; lesser effort last time.
runners.spotlight: Successful over 6f here off a 2lb lower mark a year ago but placed just once in nine subsequent outings; has often attracted market support, suggesting that he may be capable of better.

runners.name: One And Only
runners.comment: Newcomer; half-brother to four winners; placed in three of seven local trial race starts.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winners who cost AUS$26,000 as a yearling; won a trial in Australia but beaten in seven of them (three places) in Hong Kong; best watched on this debut.

runners.name: Wrote A New Page
runners.owner: Sammy Ma Hon Kit & Ronald Ma Chun Ho
runners.comment: Has yet to fall in the weights despite five defeats; 0.5l second on penultimate run.
runners.spotlight: Built on mildly promising first three starts when 0.5l second on penultimate run; not such a good effort when beaten by almost 4l last time; first run at Happy Valley.

runners.name: Nebraskan
runners.owner: Kenneth Lam Sze Ken, Timothy Junior Lam & T Fok Kwong Hang

prev_owners.owner: TFI Diamond Syndicate & Mrs L Fung

runners.comment: Front-runner; winless from 18 tries; three straight C&D places prior to modest latest run.
runners.spotlight: Likely leader who is still searching for his first triumph after 18 attempts; modest effort last time but placed over C&D on each of his three previous outings, including two 0.5l seconds.

runners.name: Positive Smile
runners.comment: Has showed ability in sprints; this trip a question mark (modest sixth on only try).
runners.spotlight: Yet to taste success in nine tries since arriving from Australia; has manage three top six finishes in sprints; this trip did not appear to be the answer when beaten 4.5l last time.

runners.name: Capital Legend
runners.comment: Out of form since a C&D victory off 8lb higher in October; revival needed.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in 2024; outside the top four in each of his last ten races; well weighted if suddenly coming back to his best.

runners.name: To Infinity
runners.owner: Chan Wing Chiu & Yildiz Choi Yat Fan
runners.comment: Inconsistent but has landed two surprise C&D victories this term; high in the weights now.
runners.spotlight: Twice a long-priced C&D scorer this season but unplaced on all 11 of his other appearances; raised 6lb for latest win; hard to predict.

runners.name: Run Yes Run
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co
runners.owner: Kong Wing Ming & Edmond Kong Chun Man
runners.comment: Up from 6f today and has been very disappointing in each of his last four outings.
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in sprints last season but has been off colour this term (moved trainer before penultimate run); needs this step up from 6f to transform him.

runners.name: Draco
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden; has run some good races (beaten only 1.25l last time); up from 7f.
runners.spotlight: Going beyond 7f for the first time; still searching for first win after ten starts; placed off slightly higher marks so could be well weighted if lack of stamina does not let him down.

runners.name: Radiant Swift
runners.owner: Lam Shui Wah, Kung Man Kai & Wancy Wong Wan Sze
runners.comment: Huge outsider and has run accordingly in both starts thus far; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Impossible to recommend after two poor displays at massive odds (1m then 7f).

runners.name: Lucky Combination
runners.comment: Yet to finish better than seventh in his first seven starts; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Yet to make the top six in the first seven races of his career, though was only beaten by 3.5l off a 4lb lower mark two starts ago.

runners.name: Denfield
runners.owner: Yue Yun Hing & Anita Yue Lam Chik Sun
runners.comment: Needs to better recent efforts but drops in grade today and is on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner in Class 4; needs to up his game after two below-par recent efforts but dips back into Class 4 today and is on a good mark now; can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Bienvenue
runners.comment: Opened account over C&D last month; Zac Purton maintains the partnership
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly to open account over C&D last month, his tenth start; 7lb higher today but is well drawn and Zac Purton maintains the partnership; good chance.

runners.name: Bowser
runners.comment: Very close third over C&D in April but faces tougher task from much wider draw today
runners.spotlight: Lost out only by two necks when third over C&D in April and has now made the frame four consecutive times but faces a tougher assignment from his much wider draw today.

runners.name: Circuit Duffy
runners.owner: Cheung Ka Shing & Jason Cheung Cho Yee
runners.comment: Made early breakthrough in November but yet to make any significant further progress
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D in November, his second start, but is yet to make any significant further progress and his recent efforts have been particularly disappointing.

runners.name: Free Pony
runners.owner: Edwin Fong Yick Chung, Edmund Ho Kwok Shing & So Wai Keung
runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who has struggled in Hong Kong this year
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who has struggled in Hong Kong this year; has much better draw than on last two outings but still makes only limited appeal.

runners.name: Fortune Warrior
runners.comment: Won comfortably on dirt in February but has looked out of sorts on recent outings
runners.spotlight: Won comfortably on dirt in February but has looked out of sorts on recent outings and it takes a leap of faith to support him today.

runners.name: Tactical Command
runners.breeder: Simms Davison & Mrs M P Schick
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner in February/March but seemingly on a tough mark now
runners.spotlight: Struck form with consecutive C&D wins in February/March but recent efforts suggest he's on a tough mark now.

runners.name: Loving Vibes
runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Placed off today's mark since opening account with C&D win in April; respected
runners.spotlight: Came good at 12th attempt, with ridden-out success over C&D in April, and posted another good effort when third off new mark a fortnight ago; respected.

runners.name: Amazing Kid
runners.comment: Looked very promising in recent trials but has tough draw for official debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a multiple 7f-1m1f winner; has looked very promising in recent trials but outside draw significantly dents his appeal on official debut.

runners.name: Alls Well
runners.breeder: Mrs H G & W G Bax
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Alan Leung Wai Zen
runners.comment: Began career with two fairly encouraging 5f runs; drawn wide for first 6f attempt
runners.spotlight: Launched career with two respectable sixths over 5f here in April; open to improvement over the extra furlong today but has double-digit draw.

runners.name: Lucky King
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on his first two appearances (1m/6f)
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on his first two appearances (1m/6f); blinkers removed from headgear combination today; favourable draw not enough to make him of interest.

runners.name: Golden Darci
runners.breeder: M W Freeman & D G Price
runners.comment: Class 5 winner on stable but well down the field in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win Class 5 C&D race on stable debut in April but finished down the field when back up in this grade later that month (7f) and may not have the early zip to make full use of his inside draw.

runners.name: No Other Choice
runners.breeder: Bred To Win Thoroughbreds Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Cheng Chung Wah & Enzo Cheng Tin Hang
runners.comment: Made a low-key debut at Sha Tin ten days ago and needs to take a big step forward here
runners.spotlight: Made a low-key debut at Sha Tin ten days ago and needs to take a big step forward here.

runners.name: Bunta Baby
runners.owner: Chu Tak Wing, Casey Chu Yin Ling & Ronald Chu Tak Wah
runners.comment: Yet to be placed after seven starts but his last two C&D runs were quite encouraging
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after seven starts but his last two C&D runs were quite encouraging; swaps blinkers for first-time visor today.

runners.name: Superb Capitalist
runners.owner: Li Cham Kuen & Li Ming Choi
runners.comment: Not beaten that far from wide stalls here on last two starts but has another tough draw
runners.spotlight: Not beaten that far from wide stalls on his two C&D runs since dropped to this grade but has not been at his best this season and has another tough draw today.

runners.name: Eternal Fortune
runners.comment: Good second over 5f here last month but outside draw a big negative today
runners.spotlight: Ran well in defeat over 5f here three weeks ago but has been rather inconsistent since his C&D win in January and his outside is a big negative today.

runners.name: Beauty Infinity
runners.comment: Reliable 5yo who scored over C&D in March and has made the frame on last two appearances
runners.spotlight: Reliable 5yo who scored over C&D in March and has made the frame over C&D on his last two appearances; likely to make presence felt again.

runners.name: Giant Leap
runners.comment: Won his last two over C&D; could take some catching from stall 1
runners.spotlight: 4yo who took his form to a new level last in April, winning twice over C&D; shooting up the ratings but has the ideal draw for a prominent racer and could take some catching.

runners.name: Storm Rider
runners.comment: Close second over C&D on last three outings; major player from stall 2
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season but has gone close three consecutive times over C&D in recent weeks; well drawn today and will be a tough nut to crack if change of headgear has any positive effect.

runners.name: Superb Boy
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Mak Yiu Hay & Mak Kai Chung
runners.comment: Seemed to have turned a corner two runs ago but his latest run was underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Seemed to have turned a corner when fourth over C&D in April but managed only eighth from the inside stall here last month and now has questions to answer again; blinkers refitted.

runners.name: Osi Honour
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Philip Ng Yuk Wing & Michael Ng Mun Kit

prev_owners.owner: K J Payne & Mrs V M Payne

runners.comment: 6f winner in Australia but makes Hong Kong debut after nearly a year on the sidelines
runners.spotlight: 6f winner on debut in Australia last May but absent since finishing well down the field in 7f Listed race a few weeks later and probably best watched on this Hong Kong debut; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: The Lion King

prev_owners.owner: M L R Whittaker, Mrs E M K Whittaker Et Al

runners.comment: Absent since winning debut in Australia in September; drawn wide for Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut in 6.2f maiden in Australia in September but not seen again since and has tough draw for this Hong Kong debut; sports first-time tongue-tie/blinkers.

runners.name: Fatal Blow
runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner in Class 4 this season; safely held when upped to this grade last month
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 4 during this first campaign; had tough draw and raced wide when only seventh in this higher grade last month but stall 9 is not ideal today either; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Find My Love
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Dannis Lee Cheuk Yin
runners.comment: Won over C&D when dipping into Class 4 in March but held three times in this grade since
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D when dipping into Class 4 in March but his three subsequent runs in this higher grade were no better than respectable and he needs to kick on again to succeed at this level.

runners.name: Storming Dragon
runners.comment: Dual 6f winner this season (once here); still in good form and back on a workable mark now
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner this season (once here); still in good form and has edged back down to a workable mark; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Ka Ying Cheer
runners.comment: Ran well on dirt in October but this is his first start for over seven months
runners.spotlight: Ran well on dirt debut in October and will be fine back on turf but this is his first start for 224 days and his usual visor is missing.

runners.name: Flying Knight
runners.owner: Shi Ke Min & Frankie Fang Yuan

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A Borges, M Ramunno Et Al

runners.comment: Ended three-race career in Australia with 7.3f maiden win in November; Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Ended three-race career in Australia with 7.3f maiden win in November; swaps blinkers for cheekpieces and has tongue-tie fitted for this Hong Kong debut; market may guide.

runners.name: Sky Cap
runners.comment: Just held on for C&D win in April; safely held in this higher grade twice since
runners.spotlight: Just held on for Class 4 C&D win in April but was safely held when returned to this higher grade for both runs last month.

runners.name: Flamingo Trillion
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner towards end of last season; drops in grade today; interesting
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner towards end of last season; below form when last in action but has posted some good efforts in higher-grade company this term and looks interesting now back in Class 3.

runners.name: Cambridge

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier/Michael Tabor/Derrick Smith/Peter M Brant

runners.comment: Came good in HK at sixth attempt, with C&D win three weeks ago; further progress possible
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at sixth attempt, with C&D win three weeks ago; went up 7lb for that but further progress is possible; one to consider.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We're pleased with that. It's been 18 years since we had a runner here and we were second that day with a subsequent Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe winner [Dylan Thomas] We thought Cambridge had improved since his run at Roscommon. He ran very green but was more professional there, the winning margin wasn't much but it's all about winning and I'm glad we have - Kevin Buckley, owners' representative.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Salisbury last season and ran well when second in the Eyrefield on his last start. He seems in good form and will probably step into a Derby trial next. 03-04-24

runners.name: Senor Toba
runners.comment: Smart in his prime but has not been firing on all cylinders for new stable this year
runners.spotlight: Smart in his prime and very well handicapped now but has not been firing on all cylinders for new stable this year; revival needed.

runners.name: Star Mac
runners.comment: Not at best last time but largely in good form since C&D win in January
runners.spotlight: Not at best when last in action but has largely remained in good form since his C&D win in January and is back on a workable mark now.

runners.name: Sharpen Bright
runners.comment: In the frame five consecutive times (1m1f-1m3f) since narrow C&D win in October
runners.spotlight: Very consistent 5yo who has made the frame five consecutive times (1m1f-1m3f) since his narrow C&D win in October; has solid each-way claims as usual.

runners.name: Luck Is Back
runners.comment: Dual Group 1 winner in Brazil but yet to be placed after seven Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Dual Group 1 winner in Brazil (1m/1m2f) but yet to be placed after seven Hong Kong starts; never a factor in recent C&D contest won by Cambridge; difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Casa Rochester
runners.comment: Scored over 1m in April; Zac Purton enlisted for this first 1m1f attempt
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier Hong Kong promise when leading on the post over 1m here in April; respectable fifth over that trip off new mark last month and has the services of Zac Purton for this first 1m1f attempt.

runners.name: Allcash
runners.comment: Finished last here a week ago and has now been unplaced all 11 Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Ran well when fourth on dirt at Sha Tin (1m) last month but finished last here when back on turf a week a ago and has now been unplaced all 11 Hong Kong starts.

runners.name: Joy Of Spring
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Edward Hung & Doris Hung
runners.comment: All four runs this year have been perfectly respectable; probably on the premises again
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two Class 4 1m1f wins and all four runs in this higher grade this year (7f-1m1f) have been perfectly respectable; ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Sturdy Ruby
runners.owner: Adam Chan Yam Man,Brian Wong Chi Fai & Alfred Chan Yam Lung
runners.comment: Usually finishes well; can snatch a minor prize if this race is run to suit
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m winner in Class 4 this season and has twice made the frame in this higher grade since; usually finishes well; can snatch another minor prize if this race is run to suit.

runners.name: Chain Of Gold
runners.comment: Finished fifth over C&D on his last two outings and continues to slip down the weights
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season and not at best in recent weeks but finished fifth over C&D on his last two outings and continues to slip down the weights.

runners.name: Good Luck Win
runners.owner: Siu Wai Chung & Lo Nga Yin
runners.comment: 1m course winner in March but has found things tougher in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly for clearcut win here (1m) in March but has found things tougher since upped to this grade for last two runs (1m/1m1f) and still needs to prove himself at this level.

runners.name: Kolachi
runners.comment: Placed at big odds in April but the rest of his HK form has been very disappointing
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo; belied triple-digit odds when placed over 1m three starts ago but his other three Hong Kong runs were very disappointing; not an easy one to predict.

runners.name: Outgate
runners.comment: Regressive 6yo who is yet to be placed after 11 starts this season
runners.spotlight: Regressive 6yo who is yet to be placed after 11 starts this season; continues to drop down the weights but needs to turn a corner.

quotes.race: Extra Places Every Day At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Outgate is a very progressive horse with a wicked turn of foot. He really filled out over the winter and keeps progressing with each run. He's developed into a proper racehorse and it would be nice to go for black type now - Claire Kubler, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything went right, Ryan [Moore] gave Outgate a beautiful ride and was very complimentary about the horse, saying he was very straightforward to ride. He's a nice horse and there's a very valuable race back here just before Royal Ascot and it might make sense to come back here for that - Daniel Kubler, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Keefy

prev_owners.owner: B K Racing & Breeding, Raffles Thoroughbred Racing Et Al

runners.comment: C&D winner off much reduced mark last month; could have a say from the inside stall
runners.spotlight: Well below best this season but scored over C&D off much reduced mark four weeks ago and has the inside stall today; contender if able to build upon that recent effort.

runners.name: Sky Trust
runners.owner: Bryan Kwan Hon Ming, Jessica Kwan Mun Hang Et Al
runners.comment: Dual winner at Sha Tin in early part of this season (7f/1m) and still in pretty good form
runners.spotlight: Dual winner at Sha Tin in early part of this season (7f/1m) and still in pretty good form; capable apprentice Ellis Wong claims a useful 7lb today; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Another World
runners.comment: Triple 7f winner this season; unexposed over 1m and might still be on the upgrade
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over 7f during this first campaign; unexposed over 1m and might still be on the upgrade; likely contender.

runners.name: Romantic Laos
runners.comment: Posted sound effort when fifth at Sha Tin last month but others look better handicapped
runners.spotlight: Four-time 1m winner, most recently in December; kept on for very respectable fifth at Sha Tin last month but may find others better handicapped again here.

runners.name: Excellence Value
runners.comment: Placed all three starts since breakthrough Hong Kong win over C&D in March
runners.spotlight: Placed all three starts since breakthrough Hong Kong win over C&D in March; creeping up the weights for his troubles but ought to be right in the thick of things again today.

runners.name: Star Contact
runners.comment: Bounced back to form and nearly caused 36-1 surpirise over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Had been out of form this year but bounced back to form and nearly caused 36-1 surprise over C&D a fortnight ago; obvious claims if in the right mood again today.

runners.name: Prestige Good
runners.comment: Emphatic C&D winner last week; up in grade today; respected in current form
runners.spotlight: Placed three consecutive times over C&D before opening his local account with emphatic success here a week ago; moves up in grade today but still respected in current form.

runners.name: Harmony Galaxy
runners.comment: Dual 1m1f course winner in April; up in grade today; drop back in trip not ideal
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong with two 1m1f course wins from off the pace in April; could plausible still have more improvement to come but moves up in grade today and the drop back in trip may not be ideal.

runners.name: Highland Rahy
runners.owner: Peter Chu Ka Lok, Maria Teresa Chu & Dr C Chu Ping Wing
runners.comment: Bang-in-form front-runner; on fairly tough mark but ought to make bold bid from stall 2
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form front-runner who won consecutive C&D races in March/April and had been placed over C&D on both starts since; on  fairly tough mark now but ought to give this a good shot from stall 2.

runners.name: Ivy League

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner last month; back up in grade today and has awkward draw
runners.spotlight: Capitalised upon dip into Class 4 when battling well for narrow C&D win last month; evidently in good nick but moves back up in grade today and has awkward draw.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Blackwater Handicap
quotes.quote: Ivy League did that nicely. He's a big strong colt and he's very babyish still, he will progress and is probably not too bad. I don't think he'll have any problem stepping into stakes company. He is not short of pace. He would love horses in front of him and a race like the Jersey Stakes could be a good option for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Ragga Bomb
runners.comment: Always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for first three Hong Kong starts (all 7f)
runners.spotlight: Showed some useful form in Ireland but was always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for first three Hong Kong starts (all 7f).

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Gleneagles Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ragga Bomb is a weak horse and that could be it for this year. He will strengthen up an awful lot for next year and seven is his trip - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Supreme Agility
runners.owner: Rotary Club Of Sha Tin Syndicate
runners.comment: 0-17 in HK; close second over C&D last month but quickly back up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Group 1 winner in Brazil but 0-17 in Hong Kong; went close over C&D when dropped to Class 4 a fortnight ago but quickly moves back up in grade today and needs to find something extra.

runners.name: Beauty Glory

prev_owners.owner: Sean Jones & Mrs L Lyons & Mrs A Brudenell & R Simmons

runners.comment: Consistent over 6f/7f in recent months and stays 1m perfectly well
runners.spotlight: Front-runner ago has been consistent over 6f/7f in recent months; unraced over 1m since 2022 but stays this trip perfectly well; could have a say if he gets a run.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse who has done it well at home for a long time. He was only ready to start. He loved that ground and Colin [Keane] said he wouldn't want it any quicker. That trip and further [suits him], he'll have no problem getting a trip. He did that well and showed a good attitude, he'll only improve. He's a good-looking horse who we're delighted with - Shane Lyons, assistant to Ger Lyons, trainer of To Glory

runners.name: A Americ Te Specso
runners.breeder: Go Racing Ltd & L J Shannon
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner in April; below that form since, though, and on tough mark now
runners.spotlight: Best known as a sprinter but has enjoyed a new lease of life over 1m in recent months, winning twice over C&D; didn't fire when last in action, though and current mark demands a career-best performance.

runners.name: Aurora Lady
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co
runners.comment: Very progressive 4yo who has collected four C&D wins this season; big player from stall 1
runners.spotlight: Very progressive 4yo who has collected four C&D wins this season; moves back up in trip after pefectly respectable 5f run five weeks ago and ought to pose a potent threat from the inside stall.

runners.name: Son Pak Fu
runners.comment: Managed a small-field C&D win in February but has not been at his best this season
runners.spotlight: Led close home to win five-runner C&D contest in February but has not been firing on all cylinders this season and needs to leave his recent efforts behind.

runners.name: Tomodachi Kokoroe
runners.comment: Placed at Sha Tin last month but has wide draw here and is no longer the force of old
runners.spotlight: Rediscovered some form when placed at Sha Tin last month and remains on a good mark but his double-digit draw is a negative here and it's not easy to predict whether he'll build on that recent effort.

runners.name: Gustosisimo
runners.comment: Career-best form when winning two starts ago but safely held off new mark since
runners.spotlight: Career-best form form when driven-out winner at Sha Tin two starts ago but was unable to land a telling blow off his new mark there last time and needs to find hidden reserves today.

runners.name: Horsepower
runners.owner: Michael T H Lee, Vanessa Lee & Amelia Lee

prev_owners.owner: Michael T H Lee & Vanessa Lee

runners.comment: 3-5 over 5f in Hong Kong; could easily have more to offer over 6f
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who won with authority over 5f here six weeks ago and is now 3-5 over that trip in Hong Kong; moves up in grade for this first 6f attempt but could still have more improvement to come.

runners.name: Wonder Kit
runners.owner: Ian Chan Yau Nam & Cyrus Chan Sing Kit

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chan Yau Nam, Cyrus Chan Sing Kit & Est Chan Wai Nam
Ian Chan Yau Nam, Chan Wai Nam & Cyrus Chan Sing Kit

runners.comment: C&D winner when dipping into Class 3 in March; faces tough task from stall 11 in Class 2
runners.spotlight: Won a shade cosily over C&D when dipping into Class 3 in March and was probably not ideally suited by the drop back to 5f when below that form on latest outing but faces a tough task from stall 11 today.

runners.name: Kaholo Angel
runners.owner: Ho Garrick Sai Man & Tam Wing Yee
runners.comment: Won two of his last three over C&D; seemingly on a tough mark now, though
runners.spotlight: In career-best form in recent weeks, winning two of his last three over C&D; well drawn again today but needs to take his form to another new level to overcome latest 6lb rise.

runners.name: Mid Winter Wind
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See
runners.comment: Surprise winner on HK debut in January but subsequent form has been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Caused 41-1 surprise on Hong Kong debut at Sha Tin (6f) in January but his subsequent form has been underwhelming; still 7lb above his winning mark; needs to get career back on track.

runners.name: Stellar Express
runners.comment: Readily made all over 5f at Sha Tin ten days ago; has tough draw for this 6f return
runners.spotlight: Made all over the straight 5f at Sha Tin ten days ago; also suited by 6f but has outside draw and recent 8lb rise to contend with today.

runners.name: Brave Star
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Matthew Lam Kin Hong
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner in early part of season but has gone off the boil this year
runners.spotlight: Began season with three consecutive C&D wins but seems to have gone off the boil since the turn of the year and remains on a fairly tough mark.

runners.name: Colourful King
runners.comment: Ex-Autralian 3yo who is 2-4 over 5f in Hong Kong this year; upped in trip today
runners.spotlight: Ex-Autralian 3yo who is 2-4 over 5f in Hong Kong this year; lost out only narrowly to Glory Elite here on latest outing and has another big role to play if this step up to 6f suits.

runners.name: Harmony N Blessed
runners.owner: Cheung Ming Man, Cheung Ying Ho Et Al
runners.comment: Won off much reduced mark a fortnight ago but younger rivals have more appealing profiles
runners.spotlight: Exploited some significant help from the handicapper when winning narrowly here a fortnight ago; well drawn again today and still well treated on older form but younger rivals appeal more all the same.

runners.name: Whizz Kid
runners.comment: Placed twice in April (6f/5f) and subsequent defeat (from stall 12) not viewed harshly
runners.spotlight: Smart in his prime; arrested his decline with two thirds in April (6f/5f) and last month's defeat from a tough draw is not viewed too harshly; will warrant each-way consideration if he gets a run today.

5:40.race_name: Beverly R Steinman Hurdle (Hurdle) (Grade 1 Handicap) (4yo+) (Mellon Course) (Turf)
